terms: PHYS 135 or PHYS 137 or EF 151 or EF 157
PHYS 136 or PHYS 138 or EF 152 or EF 158
BIOL 101 or BIOL 150 or BIOL 158 or CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128 or PHYS 231
milestones: MATH 130 or higher or one Arts and Humanities, Cultures and Civilizations, or Social Sciences Elective
CBE 201 or COSC 102 or ME 202 or MSE 201

COSC 102.title: COSC 102
COSC 102.full_description: COSC 102 - Introduction to Computer Science 4 Credit Hours Problem solving+algorithm development. Organization+characteristics of modern digital computers with emphasis on software engineering or building abstractions with procedures+data,+programming in a modern computer language. Includes Level 1 design projects or which require laboratory work. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students who have received credit for 140 or 160 may not receive subsequent credit for 102 without consent of instructor.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 141 or 147.

MATH 130.title: MATH 130
MATH 130.full_description: MATH 130 - Precalculus I 4 Credit Hours Review of algebraic or logarithmic or exponential,+trigonometric functions. Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in 141 or 147 or 151 may not subsequently receive credit for 130.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score.Comment(s): For students who satisfy the course prerequisites for 141 or 151 or but whose placement test scores indicate additional preparation is necessary.
MATH 130.prereqs: 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score

ENGL 101.title: ENGL 101
ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for 118 or 131 or 198 may not receive credit for 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for 103.

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for 101 or 131 or 198 may not receive credit for 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking 102. Students receiving a grade of B or above will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or 355.

MATH 141.title: MATH 141
MATH 141.full_description: MATH 141 - Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130 with a grade of C or better.
MATH 141.prereqs: 130 with a grade of C or better

MATH 147.title: MATH 147
MATH 147.full_description: MATH 147 - Honors: Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 141 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Credit will not be given for both 147+141 or 152.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score or permission from the instructor to enroll.
MATH 147.prereqs: 130 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 135.title: PHYS 135
PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 141.Comment(s): Alternative to 137 for physics majors.

PHYS 137.title: PHYS 137
PHYS 137.full_description: PHYS 137 - Honors: Fundamentals of Physics for Physics Majors I 5 Credit Hours Honors version of 135. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 141.Recommended Background: High school calculus+physics.Comment(s): For physics+engineering physics majors+qualified students from other majors.Registration Permission: Consent of department.

EF 151.title: EF 151
EF 151.full_description: EF 151 - Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including vectors or kinematics or Newton’s laws or forces or work-energy,+impulse-momentum. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines. Examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.(RE) Corequisite(s): 105 or Computer Science 102;+Mathematics 141 or higher.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

EF 157.title: EF 157
EF 157.full_description: EF 157 - Honors: Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 151 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.(RE) Corequisite(s): 105 or Computer Science 102;+Mathematics 141 or higher.Recommended Background: At least one year of high school physics.Registration Restriction(s): Major in the Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering; enrolled in Engineering Honors Program.

COSC 130.title: COSC 130
COSC 130.full_description: COSC 130 - Computer Organization 4 Credit Hours Number systems or Boolean algebra or combinational+sequential circuits or registers or processor functional units+control or pipelining or memory+caching or stored program computing or memory management or computer system organization,+assembly language programming. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 102.

ENGL 102.title: ENGL 102
ENGL 102.full_description: ENGL 102 - English Composition II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for 132 or 298 or 290 may not receive credit for 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for 104.

MATH 142.title: MATH 142
MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Integral calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 141 or 147.

MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 142 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 147.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for mathematics 141 or an AP Calculus score of 5 or permission of the instructor to enroll.

PHYS 136.title: PHYS 136
PHYS 136.full_description: PHYS 136 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of electricity or magnetism,+optics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.Comment(s): Alternative to 138 for physics majors.

PHYS 138.title: PHYS 138
PHYS 138.full_description: PHYS 138 - Honors: Fundamentals of Physics for Physics Majors II 5 Credit Hours Honors version of 136. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.Recommended Background: High school calculus+physics.Comment(s): For physics+engineering physics majors+qualified students from other majors.Registration Permission: Consent of department.

EF 152.title: EF 152
EF 152.full_description: EF 152 - Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including rotational dynamics or statics or oscillations or waves or fluids or heat+temperature,+first+second law of thermodynamics. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines or examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 151.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

EF 158.title: EF 158
EF 158.full_description: EF 158 - Honors: Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 152. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 157.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or higher.

BIOL 101.title: BIOL 101
BIOL 101.full_description: BIOL 101 - Introduction to Biology: Cells or Genetics,+Physiology 4 Credit Hours For non-biology majors or introduction to the principles of biology as they relate to cellular+organismal level processes. Topics include cell structure+major fundamental metabolic processes such as energy flow in biological systems or protein synthesis,+aspects of genetics. Includes a survey of human anatomy+physiology with topics relating to human health. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+one 2-hour lab.

BIOL 150.title: BIOL 150
BIOL 150.full_description: BIOL 150 - Organismal+Ecological Biology 3 Credit Hours Intended for science majors or an introduction to the major biological concepts emphasizing the organismal+ecological aspects of life. Organized along themes of evolution or structure+function or information flow or exchange+storage or pathways of energy+matter,+systems. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+one 1-hour biological literacy session (BioLit).Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both 150+158.Comment(s): Although not required or it is recommended that 150+160 be taken in sequence.

BIOL 158.title: BIOL 158
BIOL 158.full_description: BIOL 158 - Honors: Organismal+Ecological Biology 3 Credit Hours Same as 150 but designed for high achieving students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+one 1-hour discussion.Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both 150+158.Comment(s): Although not required or it is recommended that 158+168 be taken in sequence.

CHEM 100.title: CHEM 100
CHEM 100.full_description: CHEM 100 - Principles of Chemistry 4 Credit Hours Bonding+molecular structure or gas laws or liquid+solid state or solutions or colloids or acids+bases or oxidation+reduction or kinetics,+equilibria. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – 100 or 120 or 128.

CHEM 120.title: CHEM 120
CHEM 120.full_description: CHEM 120 - General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or stoichiometry or quantitative treatment of gas laws or quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or kinetics. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – 100 or 120 or 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.
CHEM 120.prereqs: Mathematics 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher

CHEM 128.title: CHEM 128
CHEM 128.full_description: CHEM 128 - Honors: General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include atomic structure+bonding or molecular structure or spectroscopy or chemical reactions+stoichiometry or introduction to organic compounds+reactions or intermolecular forces+phase transitions or behavior of gases. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – 100 or 120 or 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.
CHEM 128.prereqs: ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor

PHYS 231.title: PHYS 231
PHYS 231.full_description: PHYS 231 - Fundamentals of Physics: Electricity+Magnetism 3 Credit Hours For engineers+majors in mathematics+the physical sciences. Electric+magnetic phenomena including DC+AC circuits+electromagnetic waves. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+3 hours lab/recitation.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 135 or 137 or Engineering Fundamentals 151+152.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.

COSC 140.title: COSC 140
COSC 140.full_description: COSC 140 - Data Structures+Algorithms I 4 Credit Hours Advanced problem solving+algorithm development or programming or data structures+applications or I/O techniques or lists or queues or stacks or hash tables or algorithms or files. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130.

MATH 251.title: MATH 251
MATH 251.full_description: MATH 251 - Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours First course in the algebra of simultaneous linear equations+matrices. Includes Gaussian elimination or determinants or vector spaces or linear transformations or eigenvalues,+eigenvectors. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 257.title: MATH 257
MATH 257.full_description: MATH 257 - Honors: Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.

COSC 302.title: COSC 302
COSC 302.full_description: COSC 302 - Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental algorithms+data structures or including trees+graphs. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140.

COSC 307.title: COSC 307
COSC 307.full_description: COSC 307 - Honors: Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Same as 302 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140.

ECE 313.title: ECE 313
ECE 313.full_description: ECE 313 - Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Probability axioms or Bayes’ theorem. Discrete+continuous random variables. Probability mass functions or density functions,+joint distributions. Central limit theorem. Expectation or variance or covariance,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or 148.

ECE 317.title: ECE 317
ECE 317.full_description: ECE 317 - Honors: Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Same as 313 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or 148.

COSC 311.title: COSC 311
COSC 311.full_description: COSC 311 - Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Sets or functions or relations or equivalence relations or partial orderings+proof techniques or especially mathematical induction. Application of proof techniques to prove correctness of algorithms. Introduction to basic counting+combinatorics. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+either Mathematics 142 or 148.

COSC 317.title: COSC 317
COSC 317.full_description: COSC 317 - Honors: Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Same as 311 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+either Mathematics 142 or 148.

COSC 360.title: COSC 360
COSC 360.full_description: COSC 360 - Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to C+its use in system programming. Introduction to memory+process layout or system calls or buffering or file I/O or file systems or directories or metadata or assembly code or stack frames or memory management or process management,+interprocess communication. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130+302.

COSC 367.title: COSC 367
COSC 367.full_description: COSC 367 - Honors: Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours Same as 360 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130+302.

COSC 312.title: COSC 312
COSC 312.full_description: COSC 312 - Algorithm Analysis+Automata 3 Credit Hours Counting+combinatorics or with applications to the analysis of algorithms. Introduction to finite automata+regular languages,+to pushdown automata+context free grammars. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 311.

COSC 340.title: COSC 340
COSC 340.full_description: COSC 340 - Software Engineering 3 Credit Hours Introduction to software processes that can be used on large projects to help design or manage or maintain,+test software. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302.

COSC 361.title: COSC 361
COSC 361.full_description: COSC 361 - Operating Systems 3 Credit Hours Threads or operating system structure or process management or scheduling or synchronization or deadlock or memory management or virtual memory+demand paging or file system management+implementation or mass storage structure or protection or security,+distributed systems. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 360 or 367.

COSC 365.title: COSC 365
COSC 365.full_description: COSC 365 - Programming Languages+Systems 3 Credit Hours Language paradigms (procedural or functional or object-oriented or logic) or language design+implementation issues,+language issues related to parallelism. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302.

COSC 366.title: COSC 366
COSC 366.full_description: COSC 366 - Introduction to Cybersecurity 3 Credit Hours A broad introduction to cybersecurity concepts. The class will introduce basic topics core to understanding computer security including security goals or threat modeling or software security or operating system security or cryptography or network security,+human factors. Coursework focuses on helping students adapt a security aware mindset when designing or developing,+testing systems. Credit Restriction: Cannot receive credit for both Electrical+Computer Engineering 461+Computer Science 366.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 360 or 367.

COSC 395.title: COSC 395
COSC 395.full_description: COSC 395 - Junior Seminar 1 Credit Hours Presentations+discussions related to professional development or including registration or ethics,+current topics in computer science. Grading Restriction: Satisfactory/No Credit grading only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 302 or 307.

COSC 401.title: COSC 401
COSC 401.full_description: COSC 401 - Senior Design Theory 2 Credit Hours A design course that focuses the student’s attention on professional practice or ethics or accumulated background of curricular components,+recent developments in the field. The focus is on teaching both the design process+design principles that allow students to utilize all of the above elements to effectively create designs for major design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 360.

ENGL 355.title: ENGL 355
ENGL 355.full_description: ENGL 355 - Rhetoric+Writing 3 Credit Hours Strategies of writing on personal+academic subjects. Discussion of student+professional writing. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 102 or 118 or 132 or 290 or 298.

ENGL 360.title: ENGL 360
ENGL 360.full_description: ENGL 360 - Technical+Professional Writing 3 Credit Hours For students who need to sharpen their technical communication skills. Writing of definitions or process descriptions or proposals or abstracts or executive summaries,+major reports. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 102 or 118 or 132 or 290 or 298.Registration Restriction(s): Minimum student level – junior.

COSC 402.title: COSC 402
COSC 402.full_description: COSC 402 - Senior Design Practicum 3 Credit Hours A project-oriented course that requires teams of students to design a major project that incorporates the principles taught in 401. The design emphasis is directed to topics within the field of computer science. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC) (OC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 401;+English 102 or 132 or 290 or 298.

COSC 494.title: COSC 494
COSC 494.full_description: COSC 494 - Special Topics in Computer Science 1-3 Credit Hours Repeatability: May be repeated. Maximum 9 hours.

COSC 493.title: COSC 493
COSC 493.full_description: COSC 493 - Independent Study 1-3 Credit Hours Special project in area of student’s primary interest. Directed by computer science faculty or perhaps jointly with student’s faculty advisor. Intended for students with a specific project to pursue in conjunction with a faculty member. Project may be from a department other than computer science or in which case a faculty member from the appropriate department will help oversee the project. Repeatability: May be repeated. Maximum 45 hours.Credit Restriction: Maximum of 6 hours may be applied toward the major.Registration Permission: Consent of instructor.

COSC 440.title: COSC 440
COSC 440.full_description: COSC 440 - Formal Foundations of Software Engineering 4 Credit Hours Principles of analysis+design of information systems. Principles of program design+verification or formal objects or formal specifications. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 311.

COSC 482.title: COSC 482
COSC 482.full_description: COSC 482 - Theory of Computation 3 Credit Hours Properties of finite automata/regular sets+push-down automata/context-free languages. Countability or diagonalization,+undecidability. Complexity or including the classes P+NP or NP-completeness,+reduction techniques. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 312.

COSC 452.title: COSC 452
COSC 452.full_description: COSC 452 - Computer Graphics 3 Credit Hours Digital image synthesis or geometric modeling,+animation. Topics may include visual perception or displays+color spaces or frame buffers or affine transformations or data structures for geometric primitives or visible surface determination or shading+texturing or anti-aliasing computing light transport or rendering equation or shader programming or general purpose GPU programming or level of detail or curves+surfaces,+graphics hardware. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302 or 307.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.

COSC 462.title: COSC 462
COSC 462.full_description: COSC 462 - Parallel Programming 3 Credit Hours Principles+practice of parallel computing; design or implementation,+evaluation of parallel programs for shared+distributed memory architectures,+vector processors. Sample topics include models of parallel computers or basic communication operations or performance+scalability of parallel systems,+programming techniques including multi-threading+message passing. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 360 or 361.

ECE 453.title: ECE 453
ECE 453.full_description: ECE 453 - Introduction to Computer Networks 3 Credit Hours Introduction to the design+implementation of computer networks. Topics to be covered include layered network architecture or physical media or data link protocols or network routing or transport layer or network programming interfaces such as sockets,+applications. Examples will be primarily based on protocols in the Internet. Include Level 1 design projects with programming assignments related to networking protocols. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323.

ECE 462.title: ECE 462
ECE 462.full_description: ECE 462 - Cyber-Physical Systems Security 3 Credit Hours Introduction to security challenges+techniques at both the physical layer+the cyber layer of important cyber-physical systems or including transportation systems or avionics or industrial automation systems or vehicular systems or medical systems or power systems or SCADA or nuclear plants or etc. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Computer Science 102 or equivalent or 313 or equivalent.Registration Restriction(s): Junior standing or consent of the instructor.
ECE 462.prereqs: Computer Science 102 or equivalent or 313 or equivalent

ECE 463.title: ECE 463
ECE 463.full_description: ECE 463 - Introduction to Datacenters 3 Credit Hours Technologies+best practices in data center structure or management,+maintenance. Topics include datacenter structure+design or requirements or performance or security or power & cooling or storage systems or networking or capacity/workload management or testing,+analysis. Students from engineering disciplines that can take this course include electrical or computer or industrial or mechanical,+nuclear engineering,+computer science. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Computer Science 130.

COSC 453.title: COSC 453
COSC 453.full_description: COSC 453 - Data Visualization 3 Credit Hours The goal of this course is to develop a broad understanding of the principles or methods,+techniques for designing effective data visualizations. The course will span a wide range of topics related to interactive data visualization. The course will teach key elements of scientific visualization techniques or which graphically encode data with some physical or geometric correspondence,+information visualization techniques or which focus on abstract data without such correspondences such as symbolic or tabular or networked or hierarchical or textual information sources. The course will follow a lecture/seminar style with discussion of assigned readings or as well as viewing of videos+hands-on experience with creating visualization tools. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 140.Recommended Background: 340+452.

COSC 461.title: COSC 461
COSC 461.full_description: COSC 461 - Compilers 3 Credit Hours Lexical analysis or parsing or program representation or type systems or runtime environments or code generation or optimization techniques. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302.

COSC 465.title: COSC 465
COSC 465.full_description: COSC 465 - Databases+Scripting Languages 3 Credit Hours Introduction to database theory or models,+query formation. Survey of scripting languages or their uses,+their interconnectivity with databases. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 311.

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255.

ECE 356.title: ECE 356
ECE 356.full_description: ECE 356 - Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Architecture+design of microcomputer systems with microprocessors or microcontrollers. Instruction set architectures or software interfaces or processor structures or memory hierarchy,+interfacing. Includes Level 1 design projects which require laboratory work. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

ECE 455.title: ECE 455
ECE 455.full_description: ECE 455 - Embedded Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Design+development of embedded systems for data acquisition+special-purpose computing systems or such as peripheral interfacing or serial/parallel communications,+bus systems. Assembly language programming or software architecture,+machine architecture of microcontrollers. Includes Level 1 design projects which require laboratory work. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

COSC 370.title: COSC 370
COSC 370.full_description: COSC 370 - Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours The design or analysis,+implementation of numerical algorithms for solving problems in science+engineering. Emphasis on program design or including data structures or computational complexity or scientific computing environments,+high-performance software packages. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both 370+Mathematics 371.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+Mathematics 251.

COSC 377.title: COSC 377
COSC 377.full_description: COSC 377 - Honors: Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours Same as 370 with additional honors project. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both 377+Mathematics 371.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+Mathematics 251.

COSC 471.title: COSC 471
COSC 471.full_description: COSC 471 - Numerical Analysis 3 Credit Hours (See Mathematics 471.)

COSC 472.title: COSC 472
COSC 472.full_description: COSC 472 - Numerical Algebra 3 Credit Hours (See Mathematics 472.)

MATH 231.title: MATH 231
MATH 231.full_description: MATH 231 - Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours First course emphasizing solution techniques. Includes first-order equations+applications or theory of linear equations or equations with constant coefficients or Laplace transforms,+series solutions. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 237.title: MATH 237
MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of Math 231. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.

MATH 241.title: MATH 241
MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for mathematics 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

COSC 420.title: COSC 420
COSC 420.full_description: COSC 420 - Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Recent developments in computational methods inspired by nature or such as neural networks or genetic algorithms or evolutionary programming or ant-swarm optimization or artificial immune systems or swarm intelligence or cellular automata or multi-agent systems or cooperation,+competition. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

COSC 427.title: COSC 427
COSC 427.full_description: COSC 427 - Honors: Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Same as 420 with additional honors project. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

COSC 421.title: COSC 421
COSC 421.full_description: COSC 421 - Computational Cognitive Neuroscience 3 Credit Hours Survey of computational cognitive neuroscience. The focus is on the neuroscience of cognitive processes or including perception or categorization or memory or language or action,+executive control. Course work makes use of computer simulations of neural networks to model cognitive processes+to test hypotheses about their neural implementations. Credit Restriction: Students cannot receive credit for both 421+521.Recommended Background: Senior standing.

COSC 425.title: COSC 425
COSC 425.full_description: COSC 425 - Introduction to Machine Learning 3 Credit Hours Machine learning is concerned with computer programs that automatically improve their performance through experience. This course covers the theory+practice of machine learning from a variety of perspectives. We cover topics such as clustering or decision trees or neural network learning or statistical learning methods or Bayesian learning methods or dimension reduction or kernel methods,+reinforcement learning. Programming assignments include implementation+hands-on experiments with various learning algorithms. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Electrical+Computer Engineering 313 or 317 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 251 or 257.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.
COSC 425.prereqs: Electrical+Computer Engineering 313 or 317 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 251 or 257

ECE 471.title: ECE 471
ECE 471.full_description: ECE 471 - Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Introduction to statistical decision theory or adaptive classifiers,+supervised+unsupervised learning. Students will explore the application of these techniques in areas of current interest or such as face recognition or speech processing or remote sensing or data mining,+bioinformatics. Includes Level 1 design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 200 or Mathematics 251.

COSC 434.title: COSC 434
COSC 434.full_description: COSC 434 - Network Security 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to core Internet+wireless technologies or related security concerns or common security vulnerabilities,+good security practices. Hands-on experience exploiting network protocols+communications,+setting up secure network connections. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Electrical+Computer Engineering 453+461.

COSC 445.title: COSC 445
COSC 445.full_description: COSC 445 - Fundamentals of Digital Archeology 3 Credit Hours This is an advanced topic course focused on developing multi-disciplinary skills of discovering or retrieving or analyzing,+presenting operational data. Students will use critical thinking+intense practice solving real-world problems to recognize+address key operational issues: the lack of context or missing observations,+incorrect values. At the end of the course students will be able to discover operational data or to retrieve+store it or to recover context or to estimate the impact of missing events or to identify unreliable or incorrect values,+to present the results. Recommended Background: 340 or 370 or Electrical+Computer Engineering 313.

COSC 466.title: COSC 466
COSC 466.full_description: COSC 466 - Web Security 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to core web technologies or related security concerns,+common vulnerabilities. Hands on experience with multi-tier web applications (HTML or JavaScript or HTTP or application frameworks,+databases) or vulnerability analysis+exploitation (injection or authentication or access control or client-side+server-side issues),+building secure applications. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302.

COSC 483.title: COSC 483
COSC 483.full_description: COSC 483 - Applied Cryptography 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to the underlying mathematics or computational methodologies or associated theoretical considerations or applications,+practical cryptographic techniques. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 311 or Mathematics 251.

ECE 459.title: ECE 459
ECE 459.full_description: ECE 459 - Secure+Trustworthy Computer Hardware Design 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to a range of new developments for the design of secure+trustworthy computer hardware. Topics covered include physical+invasive attack models or side-channel analysis (SCA) attacks or physical unclonable functions or hardware-based random number generators or watermarking of intellectual property (IP) blocks or FPGA security or passive+active metering for piracy prevention,+hardware Trojan detection+isolation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255 or Computer Science 360.

ECE 469.title: ECE 469
ECE 469.full_description: ECE 469 - Mobile+Embedded Systems Security 3 Credit Hours Introduction to mobile device security with a specific emphasis on mobile phones. Focus on mobile security in payment systems or authentication (e.g. or biometric),+mobile malware. Hands-on experience with vulnerabilities+exploits with mobile device systems. In-depth case studies of mobile devices in medical device systems+transportation systems. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Computer Science 302.

ECE 347.title: ECE 347
ECE 347.full_description: ECE 347 - Honors: Fields 3 Credit Hours Same as 341 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 202+Mathematics 241.(DE) Prerequisite(s): Physics 232.

ECE 357.title: ECE 357
ECE 357.full_description: ECE 357 - Honors: Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Same as 351 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255.

ECE 358.title: ECE 358
ECE 358.full_description: ECE 358 - Honors: Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Same as 356 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

ECE 417.title: ECE 417
ECE 417.full_description: ECE 417 - Honors: Computer Control Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as 416 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316.

ECE 427.title: ECE 427
ECE 427.full_description: ECE 427 - Honors: Electric Energy Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as 421 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316+325.

ECE 477.title: ECE 477
ECE 477.full_description: ECE 477 - Honors: Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Same as 471 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 200 or Mathematics 251.

ECE 478.title: ECE 478
ECE 478.full_description: ECE 478 - Honors: Introduction to Digital Image Processing 3 Credit Hours Same as 472 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 200 or Mathematics 251.

ECE 487.title: ECE 487
ECE 487.full_description: ECE 487 - Honors: Power Electronics 3 Credit Hours Same as 481 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316+325.(DE) Prerequisite(s): 336.

Organization+characteristics of modern digital computers with emphasis on software engineering or building abstractions with procedures+data,+programming in a modern computer language. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.Credit Restriction: Students who have received credit for COSC 130 or COSC 140 may not receive subsequent credit for COSC 102.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.Recommended Background: COSC 101 or equivalent.

MATH 130.title: MATH 130
MATH 130.full_description: MATH 130 - Precalculus I 4 Credit Hours Review of algebraic or logarithmic or exponential,+trigonometric functions. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 151 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 130.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score.Comment(s): For students who satisfy the course prerequisites for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 151 or but whose placement test scores indicate additional preparation is necessary.

MATH 131.full_description: MATH 131 - Calculus 1A Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Single variable calculus or infused with precalculus or especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications+relevant precalculus. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 152 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 131.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Appropriate placement exam score.

ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or above will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

MATH 132.full_description: MATH 132 - Calculus 1B Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Continuation of MATH 131 . Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 131 .

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 141.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 132 or ENGL 298 or ENGL 290 may not receive credit for ENGL 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 104 .

MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 142 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 151 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

BIOL 101.title: BIOL 101
BIOL 101.full_description: BIOL 101 - Introduction to Biology: Cells or Genetics,+Physiology 4 Credit Hours For non-biology majors or introduction to the principles of biology as they relate to cellular+organismal level processes. Topics include cell structure+major fundamental metabolic processes such as energy flow in biological systems or protein synthesis,+aspects of genetics. Includes a survey of human anatomy+physiology with topics relating to human health. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+one 2-hour lab.

BIOL 150.full_description: BIOL 150 - Organismal+Ecological Biology 3 Credit Hours Intended for science majors or an introduction to the major biological concepts emphasizing the organismal+ecological aspects of life. Organized along themes of evolution or structure+function or information flow or exchange+storage or pathways of energy+matter,+systems. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+one 1-hour biological literacy session (BioLit).Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both BIOL 150+BIOL 158.Comment(s): Although not required or it is recommended that BIOL 150+BIOL 160 be taken in sequence.

BIOL 158.full_description: BIOL 158 - Honors: Organismal+Ecological Biology 3 Credit Hours Same as BIOL 150 but designed for high achieving students. CHEM 100.title: CHEM 100

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128.

CHEM 120.title: CHEM 120
CHEM 120.full_description: CHEM 120 - General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or stoichiometry or quantitative treatment of gas laws or quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or kinetics. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.

Credit Restriction: Cannot receive credit for both ECE 461+COSC 366.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.

Project may be from a department other than computer science or in which case a faculty member from the appropriate department will help oversee the project. Repeatability: May be repeated. COSC 452.full_description: COSC 452 - Computer Graphics 3 Credit Hours Digital image synthesis or geometric modeling,+animation. Topics may include visual perception or displays+color spaces or frame buffers or affine transformations or data structures for geometric primitives or visible surface determination or shading+texturing or anti-aliasing computing light transport or rendering equation or shader programming or general purpose GPU programming or level of detail or curves+surfaces,+graphics hardware. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.
COSC 452.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better

COSC 462.title: COSC 462
COSC 462.full_description: COSC 462 - Parallel Programming 3 Credit Hours Principles+practice of parallel computing; design or implementation,+evaluation of parallel programs for shared+distributed memory architectures,+vector processors. Sample topics include models of parallel computers or basic communication operations or performance+scalability of parallel systems,+programming techniques including multi-threading+message passing. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 462.prereqs: COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 453.title: ECE 453
ECE 453.full_description: ECE 453 - Introduction to Computer Networks 3 Credit Hours Introduction to the design+implementation of computer networks. Topics to be covered include layered network architecture or physical media or data link protocols or network routing or transport layer or network programming interfaces such as sockets,+applications. Examples will be primarily based on protocols in the Internet. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 453.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better

ECE 462.title: ECE 462
ECE 462.full_description: ECE 462 - Cyber-Physical Systems Security 3 Credit Hours Introduction to security challenges+techniques at both the physical layer+the cyber layer of important cyber-physical systems or including transportation systems or avionics or industrial automation systems or vehicular systems or medical systems or power systems or SCADA or nuclear plants or etc. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 or equivalent with a grade of C or better,+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or equivalent with a grade of C or better.Registration Restriction(s): Junior standing or consent of the instructor.
ECE 462.prereqs: COSC 102 or equivalent with a grade of C or better,+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or equivalent with a grade of C or better

ECE 463.title: ECE 463
ECE 463.full_description: ECE 463 - Introduction to Datacenters 3 Credit Hours Technologies+best practices in data center structure or management,+maintenance. Topics include datacenter structure+design or requirements or performance or security or power & cooling or storage systems or networking or capacity/workload management or testing,+analysis. Students from engineering disciplines that can take this course include electrical or computer or industrial or mechanical,+nuclear engineering,+computer science. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 130 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 463.prereqs: COSC 130 with a grade of C or better

COSC 453.title: COSC 453
COSC 453.full_description: COSC 453 - Data Visualization 3 Credit Hours The goal of this course is to develop a broad understanding of the principles or methods,+techniques for designing effective data visualizations. The course will span a wide range of topics related to interactive data visualization. The course will teach key elements of scientific visualization techniques or which graphically encode data with some physical or geometric correspondence,+information visualization techniques or which focus on abstract data without such correspondences such as symbolic or tabular or networked or hierarchical or textual information sources. The course will follow a lecture/seminar style with discussion of assigned readings or as well as viewing of videos+hands-on experience with creating visualization tools. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 140 with a grade of C or better.Recommended Background: COSC 340+COSC 452 .
COSC 453.prereqs: COSC 140 with a grade of C or better

COSC 461.title: COSC 461
COSC 461.full_description: COSC 461 - Compilers 3 Credit Hours Lexical analysis or parsing or program representation or type systems or runtime environments or code generation or optimization techniques. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 461.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better

COSC 465.title: COSC 465
COSC 465.full_description: COSC 465 - Databases+Scripting Languages 3 Credit Hours Introduction to database theory or models,+query formation. Survey of scripting languages or their uses,+their interconnectivity with databases. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 311 or COSC 317 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 465.prereqs: COSC 311 or COSC 317 with a grade of C or better

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 256.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 356.title: ECE 356
ECE 356.full_description: ECE 356 - Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Architecture+design of microcomputer systems with microprocessors or microcontrollers. Instruction set architectures or software interfaces or processor structures or memory hierarchy,+interfacing. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 356.prereqs: ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 455.title: ECE 455
ECE 455.full_description: ECE 455 - Embedded Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Design+development of embedded systems for data acquisition+special-purpose computing systems or such as peripheral interfacing or serial/parallel communications,+bus systems. Assembly language programming or software architecture,+machine architecture of microcontrollers. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 455.prereqs: ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

COSC 370.title: COSC 370
COSC 370.full_description: COSC 370 - Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours The design or analysis,+implementation of numerical algorithms for solving problems in science+engineering. Emphasis on program design or including data structures or computational complexity or scientific computing environments,+high-performance software packages. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both COSC 370+MATH 371 .(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 140 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 370.prereqs: COSC 140 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 377.title: COSC 377
COSC 377.full_description: COSC 377 - Honors: Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 370 with additional honors project. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both COSC 377+MATH 371 .(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 140 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 377.prereqs: COSC 140 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 471.title: COSC 471
COSC 471.full_description: COSC 471 - Numerical Analysis 3 Credit Hours (See MATH 471 .)

COSC 472.title: COSC 472
COSC 472.full_description: COSC 472 - Numerical Algebra 3 Credit Hours (See MATH 472 .)

MATH 231.title: MATH 231
MATH 231.full_description: MATH 231 - Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours First course emphasizing solution techniques. Includes first-order equations+applications or theory of linear equations or equations with constant coefficients or Laplace transforms,+series solutions. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 237.title: MATH 237
MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 231 . (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

MATH 241.title: MATH 241
MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

COSC 420.title: COSC 420
COSC 420.full_description: COSC 420 - Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Recent developments in computational methods inspired by nature or such as neural networks or genetic algorithms or evolutionary programming or ant-swarm optimization or artificial immune systems or swarm intelligence or cellular automata or multi-agent systems or cooperation,+competition. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

COSC 427.title: COSC 427
COSC 427.full_description: COSC 427 - Honors: Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 420 with additional honors project. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

COSC 421.title: COSC 421
COSC 421.full_description: COSC 421 - Computational Cognitive Neuroscience 3 Credit Hours Survey of computational cognitive neuroscience. The focus is on the neuroscience of cognitive processes or including perception or categorization or memory or language or action,+executive control. Course work makes use of computer simulations of neural networks to model cognitive processes+to test hypotheses about their neural implementations. Credit Restriction: Students cannot receive credit for both COSC 421+COSC 521.Recommended Background: Senior standing.

COSC 425.title: COSC 425
COSC 425.full_description: COSC 425 - Introduction to Machine Learning 3 Credit Hours Machine learning is concerned with computer programs that automatically improve their performance through experience. This course covers the theory+practice of machine learning from a variety of perspectives. We cover topics such as clustering or decision trees or neural network learning or statistical learning methods or Bayesian learning methods or dimension reduction or kernel methods,+reinforcement learning. Programming assignments include implementation+hands-on experiments with various learning algorithms. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.
COSC 425.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 471.title: ECE 471
ECE 471.full_description: ECE 471 - Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Introduction to statistical decision theory or adaptive classifiers,+supervised+unsupervised learning. Students will explore the application of these techniques in areas of current interest or such as face recognition or speech processing or remote sensing or data mining,+bioinformatics. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 471.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 434.title: COSC 434
COSC 434.full_description: COSC 434 - Network Security 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to core Internet+wireless technologies or related security concerns or common security vulnerabilities,+good security practices. Hands-on experience exploiting network protocols+communications,+setting up secure network connections. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 366 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 453 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 434.prereqs: COSC 366 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 453 with a grade of C or better

COSC 445.title: COSC 445
COSC 445.full_description: COSC 445 - Fundamentals of Digital Archeology 3 Credit Hours This is an advanced topic course focused on developing multi-disciplinary skills of discovering or retrieving or analyzing,+presenting operational data. Students will use critical thinking+intense practice solving real-world problems to recognize+address key operational issues: the lack of context or missing observations,+incorrect values. At the end of the course students will be able to discover operational data or to retrieve+store it or to recover context or to estimate the impact of missing events or to identify unreliable or incorrect values,+to present the results. Recommended Background: COSC 340 or COSC 370 or ECE 313 .

COSC 466.title: COSC 466
COSC 466.full_description: COSC 466 - Software Security 3 Credit Hours An in-depth introduction to software security. The focus is on identifying vulnerabilities in software or exploiting vulnerabilities in software,+software development best practices for avoiding vulnerabilities during the design or implementation or testing,+deployment of software. Coursework involves hands on experience exploiting software vulnerabilities to increase understanding or awareness,+appreciation of software vulnerabilities. Credit Restriction: Students cannot receive credit for both COSC 466+COSC 566 (see graduate catalog for course description).(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 366 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 466.prereqs: COSC 366 with a grade of C or better

COSC 469.title: COSC 469
COSC 469.full_description: COSC 469 - Human Factors in Cybersecurity 3 Credit Hours A broad introduction to human-computer interaction (HCI)+its impact on the theory+practice of cybersecurity. Topics include the research methods in HCI or ethics or authentication or usable secure communication or phishing or usable cryptographic libraries or inclusivity/diversity in system design,+human-aware policy creation. Coursework focuses on helping students adapt a human-aware mindset regarding the design or implementation,+use of cybersecurity tools+principles. Credit Restriction: Students cannot receive credit for both COSC 469+COSC 569 (see graduate catalog for course description).(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 366 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 469.prereqs: COSC 366 with a grade of C or better

COSC 483.title: COSC 483
COSC 483.full_description: COSC 483 - Applied Cryptography 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to the underlying mathematics or computational methodologies or associated theoretical considerations or applications,+practical cryptographic techniques. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 311 or COSC 317 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 483.prereqs: COSC 311 or COSC 317 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 with a grade of C or better

ECE 459.title: ECE 459
ECE 459.full_description: ECE 459 - Secure+Trustworthy Computer Hardware Design 3 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to a range of new developments for the design of secure+trustworthy computer hardware. Topics covered include physical+invasive attack models or side-channel analysis (SCA) attacks or physical unclonable functions or hardware-based random number generators or watermarking of intellectual property (IP) blocks or FPGA security or passive+active metering for piracy prevention,+hardware Trojan detection+isolation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 459.prereqs: ECE 255 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 469.title: ECE 469
ECE 469.full_description: ECE 469 - Mobile+Embedded Systems Security 3 Credit Hours Introduction to vulnerabilities+threat vectors associated with mobile+embedded devices or such as smartphones or wearable devices,+IoT devices. Topics include security features+limitations of mobile operating systems or secure programming or mobile location+activity privacy or user/device authentication or IoT wireless security or side-channel attacks on mobile/wearable devices,+security+privacy breaches on smart home devices. Coursework focuses on improving knowledge+awareness of mobile+embedded systems’ security issues or through individual homework assignments+an intensive group project involving hands-on research. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 469.prereqs: COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 347.title: ECE 347
ECE 347.full_description: ECE 347 - Honors: Fields 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 341 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better.(DE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 232.
ECE 347.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better

COSC 101.title: COSC 101
COSC 101.full_description: COSC 101 - Introduction to Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to computational thinking+structured programming. Topics include problem solving+algorithm development with emphasis on conditional if/else statements or loop based iteration,+function calls. Students will also be given an overview of commonly used data structures such as arrays. Skills learned include designing a program to solving a problem or developing the algorithms needed or writing code to implement them or testing the code+correcting errors or as well as documenting how the code works.

MATH 130.title: MATH 130
MATH 130.full_description: MATH 130 - Precalculus I 4 Credit Hours Review of algebraic or logarithmic or exponential,+trigonometric functions. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 151 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 130.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score.Comment(s): For students who satisfy the course prerequisites for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 151 or but whose placement test scores indicate additional preparation is necessary.

MATH 131.full_description: MATH 131 - Calculus 1A Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Single variable calculus or infused with precalculus or especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications+relevant precalculus. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 152 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 131.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Appropriate placement exam score.

ENGL 101.title: ENGL 101
ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or above will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

MATH 132.full_description: MATH 132 - Calculus 1B Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Continuation of MATH 131 . Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 131 .

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 141.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.

PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 137 for physics majors.

EF 151.title: EF 151
EF 151.full_description: EF 151 - Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including vectors or kinematics or Newton’s laws or forces or work-energy,+impulse-momentum. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines. Examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.
EF 151.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

EF 157.title: EF 157
EF 157.full_description: EF 157 - Honors: Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 151 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Recommended Background: At least one year of high school physics.Registration Restriction(s): Major in the Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering; enrolled in Engineering Honors Program.
EF 157.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

COSC 102.title: COSC 102
COSC 102.full_description: COSC 102 - Introduction to Computer Science 4 Credit Hours Modular programming in an object-oriented programming language or including string+vector manipulation or file I/O or bit operators or Boolean algebra or pointers or simple sorting+binary search or plus introductions to recursion+templates. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.Credit Restriction: Students who have received credit for COSC 202 or COSC 230 may not receive subsequent credit for COSC 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 101 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.

ENGL 102.title: ENGL 102
ENGL 102.full_description: ENGL 102 - English Composition II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in ENGL 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 132 or ENGL 298 or ENGL 290 may not receive credit for ENGL 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 104 .

MATH 142.title: MATH 142
MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Integral calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.

MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 142 for well-prepared students. PHYS 136.title: PHYS 136
PHYS 136.full_description: PHYS 136 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of electricity or magnetism,+optics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 138 for physics majors.

PHYS 138.title: PHYS 138
PHYS 138.full_description: PHYS 138 - Honors: Fundamentals of Physics for Physics Majors II 5 Credit Hours Honors version of PHYS 136. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Recommended Background: High school calculus+physics.Comment(s): For physics+engineering physics majors+qualified students from other majors.Registration Permission: Consent of department.

EF 152.full_description: EF 152 - Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including rotational dynamics or statics or oscillations or waves or fluids or heat+temperature,+first+second law of thermodynamics. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines or examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 151 with a grade of C or better or EF 142 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

EF 158.full_description: EF 158 - Honors: Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 152. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 157 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142 or higher.
