MATH 147.prereqs: 130 with a grade of C or better

COSC 130.title: COSC 130
COSC 130.full_description: COSC 130 - Computer Organization 4 Credit Hours Number systems or Boolean algebra or combinational+sequential circuits or registers or processor functional units+control or pipelining or memory+caching or stored program computing or memory management or computer system organization,+assembly language programming. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 102.

EF 152.title: EF 152
EF 152.full_description: EF 152 - Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including rotational dynamics or statics or oscillations or waves or fluids or heat+temperature,+first+second law of thermodynamics. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines or examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 151.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

EF 158.title: EF 158
EF 158.full_description: EF 158 - Honors: Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 152. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 157.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or higher.

ENGL 102.title: ENGL 102
ENGL 102.full_description: ENGL 102 - English Composition II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: A or B or C or No Credit grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for 132 or 298 or 290 may not receive credit for 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for 104.

MATH 142.title: MATH 142
MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Integral calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 141 or 147.

MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of 142 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 147.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for mathematics 141 or an AP Calculus score of 5 or permission of the instructor to enroll.

COSC 140.title: COSC 140
COSC 140.full_description: COSC 140 - Data Structures+Algorithms I 4 Credit Hours Advanced problem solving+algorithm development or programming or data structures+applications or I/O techniques or lists or queues or stacks or hash tables or algorithms or files. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130.

PHYS 135.title: PHYS 135
PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 141.Comment(s): Alternative to 137 for physics majors.

ECE 201.title: ECE 201
ECE 201.full_description: ECE 201 - Circuits I 3 Credit Hours Fundamental laws of circuit analysis. Ohm’s Law. Kirchhoff’s current+voltage laws; the law of conservation of energy; circuits containing independent+dependent voltage,+current sources or resistance or conductance or capacitance,+inductance analyzed using mesh+nodal analysis or superposition,+source of transformations;+Norton’s+Thevenin’s Theorems. Steady state analysis of DC+AC circuits. Complete solution for transient analysis for circuits with one+two storage elements. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Engineering Fundamentals 152 or 158+Mathematics 142 or 148 with grades of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 231.Registration Permission: Consent of associate department head.
ECE 201.prereqs: Engineering Fundamentals 152 or 158+Mathematics 142 or 148 with grades of C or better

ECE 255.title: ECE 255
ECE 255.full_description: ECE 255 - Introduction to Logic Design of Digital Systems 3 Credit Hours Standard codes or number systems or base conversions,+computer arithmetic. Boolean algebra or minimization,+synthesis techniques for combinational+sequential logic. Use of VHDL for logic synthesis. Implementation of circuits using SSI or MSI,+LSI components. Includes Level 1 design projects which require laboratory work. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Computer Science 130.

PHYS 231.title: PHYS 231
PHYS 231.full_description: PHYS 231 - Fundamentals of Physics: Electricity+Magnetism 3 Credit Hours For engineers+majors in mathematics+the physical sciences. Electric+magnetic phenomena including DC+AC circuits+electromagnetic waves. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+3 hours lab/recitation.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 135 or 137 or Engineering Fundamentals 151+152.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.

MATH 231.title: MATH 231
MATH 231.full_description: MATH 231 - Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours First course emphasizing solution techniques. Includes first-order equations+applications or theory of linear equations or equations with constant coefficients or Laplace transforms,+series solutions. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 237.title: MATH 237
MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of Math 231. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.

CHEM 120.title: CHEM 120
CHEM 120.full_description: CHEM 120 - General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or stoichiometry or quantitative treatment of gas laws or quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or kinetics. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – 100 or 120 or 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.
CHEM 120.prereqs: Mathematics 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher

CHEM 128.title: CHEM 128
CHEM 128.full_description: CHEM 128 - Honors: General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include atomic structure+bonding or molecular structure or spectroscopy or chemical reactions+stoichiometry or introduction to organic compounds+reactions or intermolecular forces+phase transitions or behavior of gases. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – 100 or 120 or 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.
CHEM 128.prereqs: ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor

PHYS 136.title: PHYS 136
PHYS 136.full_description: PHYS 136 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of electricity or magnetism,+optics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): Mathematics 142.Comment(s): Alternative to 138 for physics majors.

ECE 202.title: ECE 202
ECE 202.full_description: ECE 202 - Circuits II 3 Credit Hours Operational amplifiers or average or complex or imaginary+real power; effective values of voltage+currents or three phase circuits or delta+wye connections. Complex frequency; sinusoidal forcing functions+natural response. Resonance: general case or special cases in series+parallel circuits. Scaling: magnitude+frequency. Mutual inductance or transformers as circuit elements; linear+ideal transformers. Admittance or impedance,+hybrid parameters. Trigonometric+complex Fourier series. Includes laboratory exercises. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 201.

MATH 241.title: MATH 241
MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for mathematics 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

MATH 251.title: MATH 251
MATH 251.full_description: MATH 251 - Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours First course in the algebra of simultaneous linear equations+matrices. Includes Gaussian elimination or determinants or vector spaces or linear transformations or eigenvalues,+eigenvectors. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 142 or 148.

MATH 257.title: MATH 257
MATH 257.full_description: MATH 257 - Honors: Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): 148.

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255.

COSC 302.title: COSC 302
COSC 302.full_description: COSC 302 - Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental algorithms+data structures or including trees+graphs. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140.

COSC 307.title: COSC 307
COSC 307.full_description: COSC 307 - Honors: Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Same as 302 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140.

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255.

ECE 357.title: ECE 357
ECE 357.full_description: ECE 357 - Honors: Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Same as 351 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 255.

ECE 335.title: ECE 335
ECE 335.full_description: ECE 335 - Electronic Devices 3 Credit Hours Semiconductor physics or theory of p-n junctions. Diodes or field-effect transistors,+bipolar transistors. Modeling of diode+transistor devices. Analysis+design of diode switching+rectifier circuits. Basic transistor switching circuits+single stage amplifiers. Electronic circuit simulation using SPICE. Includes 1-credit laboratory work involving Level 1 design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 202.

ECE 395.title: ECE 395
ECE 395.full_description: ECE 395 - Junior Seminar 1 Credit Hours Presentations+discussions related to professional development or including registration or ethics,+current topics in electrical engineering. Grading Restriction: Satisfactory/No Credit grading only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 202.

ECE 313.title: ECE 313
ECE 313.full_description: ECE 313 - Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Probability axioms or Bayes’ theorem. Discrete+continuous random variables. Probability mass functions or density functions,+joint distributions. Central limit theorem. Expectation or variance or covariance,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or 148.

ECE 317.title: ECE 317
ECE 317.full_description: ECE 317 - Honors: Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Same as 313 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): Mathematics 142 or 148.

COSC 317.title: COSC 317
COSC 317.full_description: COSC 317 - Honors: Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Same as 311 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+either Mathematics 142 or 148.

COSC 360.title: COSC 360
COSC 360.full_description: COSC 360 - Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to C+its use in system programming. Introduction to memory+process layout or system calls or buffering or file I/O or file systems or directories or metadata or assembly code or stack frames or memory management or process management,+interprocess communication. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130+302.

COSC 367.title: COSC 367
COSC 367.full_description: COSC 367 - Honors: Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours Same as 360 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 130+302.

ECE 315.title: ECE 315
ECE 315.full_description: ECE 315 - Signals+Systems I 3 Credit Hours Continuous-+discrete-time functions or function transformations or signal energy+power or solution of linear differential equations or system properties or convolution or continuous+discrete-time Fourier series or continuous+discrete-time Fourier transforms or Bode diagrams,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 202.

ECE 356.title: ECE 356
ECE 356.full_description: ECE 356 - Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Architecture+design of microcomputer systems with microprocessors or microcontrollers. Instruction set architectures or software interfaces or processor structures or memory hierarchy,+interfacing. Includes Level 1 design projects which require laboratory work. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

ECE 358.title: ECE 358
ECE 358.full_description: ECE 358 - Honors: Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Same as 356 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

ECE 401.title: ECE 401
ECE 401.full_description: ECE 401 - Senior Design Theory 2 Credit Hours A design course that focuses the student’s attention on professional practice or ethics or accumulated background of curricular components,+recent developments in the field. The focus is on teaching both the design process+design principles that allow students to utilize all of the above elements to effectively create designs for major design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 315 or 351.

ECE 402.title: ECE 402
ECE 402.full_description: ECE 402 - Senior Design Practicum 3 Credit Hours A project-oriented course that requires teams of students to design a major project that incorporates the principles taught in 401. The design emphasis is directed to topics within the field of electrical+computer engineering. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC) (OC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): 401;+English 102 or 132 or 290 or 298.

COSC 340.title: COSC 340
COSC 340.full_description: COSC 340 - Software Engineering 3 Credit Hours Introduction to software processes that can be used on large projects to help design or manage or maintain,+test software. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 302.

COSC 361.title: COSC 361
COSC 361.full_description: COSC 361 - Operating Systems 3 Credit Hours Threads or operating system structure or process management or scheduling or synchronization or deadlock or memory management or virtual memory+demand paging or file system management+implementation or mass storage structure or protection or security,+distributed systems. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 360 or 367.

COSC 366.title: COSC 366
COSC 366.full_description: COSC 366 - Introduction to Cybersecurity 3 Credit Hours A broad introduction to cybersecurity concepts. The class will introduce basic topics core to understanding computer security including security goals or threat modeling or software security or operating system security or cryptography or network security,+human factors. Coursework focuses on helping students adapt a security aware mindset when designing or developing,+testing systems. Credit Restriction: Cannot receive credit for both Electrical+Computer Engineering 461+Computer Science 366.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 360 or 367.

ECE 433.title: ECE 433
ECE 433.full_description: ECE 433 - Introduction to VLSI 3 Credit Hours Investigates the behavior of microelectronic devices in digital circuits+helps the students develop an understanding of the relationship between the device physics+the device static+dynamic characteristics. Includes laboratory assignments which are designed to give advanced undergraduate students a working knowledge of CMOS digital integrated circuit technology or circuit design methodologies or including simulation+physical layout of CMOS digital circuit structures. (DE) Prerequisite(s): 335.

ECE 453.title: ECE 453
ECE 453.full_description: ECE 453 - Introduction to Computer Networks 3 Credit Hours Introduction to the design+implementation of computer networks. Topics to be covered include layered network architecture or physical media or data link protocols or network routing or transport layer or network programming interfaces such as sockets,+applications. Examples will be primarily based on protocols in the Internet. Include Level 1 design projects with programming assignments related to networking protocols. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323.

ECE 455.title: ECE 455
ECE 455.full_description: ECE 455 - Embedded Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Design+development of embedded systems for data acquisition+special-purpose computing systems or such as peripheral interfacing or serial/parallel communications,+bus systems. Assembly language programming or software architecture,+machine architecture of microcontrollers. Includes Level 1 design projects which require laboratory work. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 256 or 336 or Computer Science 360 or 367.

COSC 377.title: COSC 377
COSC 377.full_description: COSC 377 - Honors: Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours Same as 370 with additional honors project. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both 377+Mathematics 371.(RE) Prerequisite(s): 140+Mathematics 251.

COSC 427.title: COSC 427
COSC 427.full_description: COSC 427 - Honors: Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Same as 420 with additional honors project. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

ECE 347.title: ECE 347
ECE 347.full_description: ECE 347 - Honors: Fields 3 Credit Hours Same as 341 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 202+Mathematics 241.(DE) Prerequisite(s): Physics 232.

ECE 417.title: ECE 417
ECE 417.full_description: ECE 417 - Honors: Computer Control Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as 416 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316.

ECE 427.title: ECE 427
ECE 427.full_description: ECE 427 - Honors: Electric Energy Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as 421 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316+325.

ECE 477.title: ECE 477
ECE 477.full_description: ECE 477 - Honors: Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Same as 471 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 200 or Mathematics 251.

ECE 478.title: ECE 478
ECE 478.full_description: ECE 478 - Honors: Introduction to Digital Image Processing 3 Credit Hours Same as 472 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 313 or Mathematics 323; Mathematics 200 or Mathematics 251.

ECE 487.title: ECE 487
ECE 487.full_description: ECE 487 - Honors: Power Electronics 3 Credit Hours Same as 481 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): 316+325.(DE) Prerequisite(s): 336.

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or above will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

MATH 132.title: MATH 132
MATH 132.full_description: MATH 132 - Calculus 1B Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Continuation of MATH 131 . Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 131 .

MATH 141.title: MATH 141
MATH 141.full_description: MATH 141 - Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 141.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.
MATH 141.prereqs: MATH 130 with a grade of C or better

MATH 147.title: MATH 147

Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 with a grade of C or better.

EF 158.title: EF 158

MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 142 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 147.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or an AP Calculus score of 5 or permission of the instructor to enroll.

COSC 140.title: COSC 140
COSC 140.full_description: COSC 140 - Data Structures+Algorithms I 4 Credit Hours Advanced problem solving+algorithm development or programming or data structures+applications or I/O techniques or lists or queues or stacks or hash tables or algorithms or files. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 130 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 140.prereqs: COSC 130 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 137 for physics majors.

ECE 201.title: ECE 201
ECE 201.full_description: ECE 201 - Circuits I 3 Credit Hours Fundamental laws of circuit analysis. Ohm’s Law. Kirchhoff’s current+voltage laws; the law of conservation of energy; circuits containing independent+dependent voltage,+current sources or resistance or conductance or capacitance,+inductance analyzed using mesh+nodal analysis or superposition,+source of transformations;+Norton’s+Thevenin’s Theorems. Steady state analysis of DC+AC circuits. Complete solution for transient analysis for circuits with one+two storage elements. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 231 .Registration Permission: Consent of associate department head.
ECE 201.prereqs: EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

ECE 255.title: ECE 255
ECE 255.full_description: ECE 255 - Introduction to Logic Design of Digital Systems 3 Credit Hours Standard codes or number systems or base conversions,+computer arithmetic. Boolean algebra or minimization,+synthesis techniques for combinational+sequential logic. Use of VHDL for logic synthesis. Implementation of circuits using SSI or MSI,+LSI components. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 130 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 255.prereqs: COSC 130 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 231.title: PHYS 231
PHYS 231.full_description: PHYS 231 - Fundamentals of Physics: Electricity+Magnetism 3 Credit Hours For engineers+majors in mathematics+the physical sciences. Electric+magnetic phenomena including DC+AC circuits+electromagnetic waves. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+3 hours lab/recitation.(RE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 135 or PHYS 137 or EF 151 or EF 152.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.

MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 231 . (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

CHEM 120.title: CHEM 120

Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or stoichiometry or quantitative treatment of gas laws or quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or kinetics. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.

CHEM 128.title: CHEM 128
CHEM 128.full_description: CHEM 128 - Honors: General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include atomic structure+bonding or molecular structure or spectroscopy or chemical reactions+stoichiometry or introduction to organic compounds+reactions or intermolecular forces+phase transitions or behavior of gases. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.

Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 138 for physics majors.

ECE 202.title: ECE 202
ECE 202.full_description: ECE 202 - Circuits II 3 Credit Hours Operational amplifiers or average or complex or imaginary+real power; effective values of voltage+currents or three phase circuits or delta+wye connections. Complex frequency; sinusoidal forcing functions+natural response. Resonance: general case or special cases in series+parallel circuits. Scaling: magnitude+frequency. Mutual inductance or transformers as circuit elements; linear+ideal transformers. Admittance or impedance,+hybrid parameters. Trigonometric+complex Fourier series. Includes laboratory exercises. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 201 with a grade of C or better.

MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

MATH 251.title: MATH 251

MATH 257.full_description: MATH 257 - Honors: Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.

COSC 302.full_description: COSC 302 - Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental algorithms+data structures or including trees+graphs. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 140 with a grade of C or better.

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.

ECE 401.prereqs: ECE 315 or ECE 351 or ECE 357 with a grade of C or better

Coursework focuses on helping students adapt a security aware mindset when designing or developing,+testing systems. Credit Restriction: Cannot receive credit for both ECE 461+COSC 366.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.

Skills learned include designing a program to solving a problem or developing the algorithms needed or writing code to implement them or testing the code+correcting errors or as well as documenting how the code works.

EF 151.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

EF 157.title: EF 157
EF 157.full_description: EF 157 - Honors: Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 151 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Recommended Background: At least one year of high school physics.Registration Restriction(s): Major in the Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering; enrolled in Engineering Honors Program.
EF 157.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

ENGL 101.title: ENGL 101
ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or above will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

MATH 132.title: MATH 132
MATH 132.full_description: MATH 132 - Calculus 1B Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Continuation of MATH 131 . Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 131 .

MATH 141.title: MATH 141
MATH 141.full_description: MATH 141 - Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 141.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.
MATH 141.prereqs: MATH 130 with a grade of C or better

MATH 147.title: MATH 147
MATH 147.full_description: MATH 147 - Honors: Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 141 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)Credit Restriction: Credit will not be given for both MATH 147+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 152.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score or permission from the instructor to enroll.
MATH 147.prereqs: MATH 130 with a grade of C or better

COSC 102.title: COSC 102
COSC 102.full_description: COSC 102 - Introduction to Computer Science 4 Credit Hours Modular programming in an object-oriented programming language or including string+vector manipulation or file I/O or bit operators or Boolean algebra or pointers or simple sorting+binary search or plus introductions to recursion+templates. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.Credit Restriction: Students who have received credit for COSC 202 or COSC 230 may not receive subsequent credit for COSC 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 101 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.
COSC 102.prereqs: COSC 101 with a grade of C or better

EF 152.title: EF 152
EF 152.full_description: EF 152 - Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including rotational dynamics or statics or oscillations or waves or fluids or heat+temperature,+first+second law of thermodynamics. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines or examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 151 with a grade of C or better or EF 142 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.
EF 152.prereqs: EF 151 with a grade of C or better or EF 142 with a grade of C or better

EF 158.title: EF 158
EF 158.full_description: EF 158 - Honors: Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 152. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 157 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142 or higher.
EF 158.prereqs: EF 157 with a grade of C or better

ENGL 102.title: ENGL 102
ENGL 102.full_description: ENGL 102 - English Composition II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in ENGL 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 132 or ENGL 298 or ENGL 290 may not receive credit for ENGL 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 104 .

MATH 142.title: MATH 142
MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Integral calculus with applications. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.

MATH 148.title: MATH 148
MATH 148.full_description: MATH 148 - Honors: Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 142 for well-prepared students. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 147.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or an AP Calculus score of 5 or permission of the instructor to enroll.

COSC 202.title: COSC 202
COSC 202.full_description: COSC 202 - Data Structures+Algorithms I 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental data structures+algorithms including lists or stacks or queues or hash tables or binary search trees+heaps. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 202.prereqs: COSC 102 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 135.title: PHYS 135
PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 137 for physics majors.

ECE 201.title: ECE 201
ECE 201.full_description: ECE 201 - Circuits I 3 Credit Hours Fundamental laws of circuit analysis. Ohm’s Law. Kirchhoff’s current+voltage laws; the law of conservation of energy; circuits containing independent+dependent voltage,+current sources or resistance or conductance or capacitance,+inductance analyzed using mesh+nodal analysis or superposition,+source of transformations;+Norton’s+Thevenin’s Theorems. Steady state analysis of DC+AC circuits. Complete solution for transient analysis for circuits with one+two storage elements. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 231 .Comment(s): For electrical engineering+computer engineering students only.Registration Permission: Consent of associate department head.
ECE 201.prereqs: EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

ECE 255.title: ECE 255
ECE 255.full_description: ECE 255 - Introduction to Logic Design of Digital Systems 3 Credit Hours Standard codes or number systems or base conversions,+computer arithmetic. Boolean algebra or minimization,+synthesis techniques for combinational+sequential logic. Use of VHDL for logic synthesis. Implementation of circuits using SSI or MSI,+LSI components. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 255.prereqs: COSC 102 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 231.title: PHYS 231
PHYS 231.full_description: PHYS 231 - Fundamentals of Physics: Electricity+Magnetism 3 Credit Hours For engineers+majors in mathematics+the physical sciences. Electric+magnetic phenomena including DC+AC circuits+electromagnetic waves. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 2 hours lecture+3 hours lab/recitation.(RE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 135 or PHYS 137 or EF 151 or EF 152.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.
PHYS 231.prereqs: PHYS 135 or PHYS 137 or EF 151 or EF 152

MATH 231.title: MATH 231
MATH 231.full_description: MATH 231 - Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours First course emphasizing solution techniques. Includes first-order equations+applications or theory of linear equations or equations with constant coefficients or Laplace transforms,+series solutions. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 237.title: MATH 237
MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 231 . (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

CHEM 122.title: CHEM 122
CHEM 122.full_description: CHEM 122 - General Chemistry I 3 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or molecular structures+geometries or stoichiometry,+quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or gas laws,+chemical energy. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 102 or CHEM 122 or CHEM 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 123.
CHEM 122.prereqs: MATH 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher

CHEM 123.title: CHEM 123
CHEM 123.full_description: CHEM 123 - General Chemistry I Laboratory 1 Credit Hours Experiments focusing on the topics discussed in CHEM 122+covering the basic techniques of measuring+analyzing data from chemical reactions. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 122.

CHEM 128.title: CHEM 128
CHEM 128.full_description: CHEM 128 - Honors: General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include atomic structure+bonding or molecular structure or spectroscopy or chemical reactions+stoichiometry or introduction to organic compounds+reactions or intermolecular forces+phase transitions or behavior of gases. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses or sequences – CHEM 112-CHEM 113 or CHEM 122-CHEM 123 or CHEM 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.
CHEM 128.prereqs: ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor

PHYS 136.title: PHYS 136
PHYS 136.full_description: PHYS 136 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of electricity or magnetism,+optics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 138 for physics majors.

ECE 202.title: ECE 202
ECE 202.full_description: ECE 202 - Circuits II 3 Credit Hours Operational amplifiers or average or complex or imaginary+real power; effective values of voltage+currents or three phase circuits or delta+wye connections. Complex frequency; sinusoidal forcing functions+natural response. Resonance: general case or special cases in series+parallel circuits. Scaling: magnitude+frequency. Mutual inductance or transformers as circuit elements; linear+ideal transformers. Admittance or impedance,+hybrid parameters. Trigonometric+complex Fourier series. Includes laboratory exercises. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 201 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 202.prereqs: ECE 201 with a grade of C or better

MATH 241.title: MATH 241
MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

MATH 251.title: MATH 251
MATH 251.full_description: MATH 251 - Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours First course in the algebra of simultaneous linear equations+matrices. Includes Gaussian elimination or determinants or vector spaces or linear transformations or eigenvalues,+eigenvectors. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 257.title: MATH 257
MATH 257.full_description: MATH 257 - Honors: Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 256.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

COSC 302.title: COSC 302
COSC 302.full_description: COSC 302 - Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental data structures+algorithms including list+tree-based sorting or graph algorithms+dynamic programming. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 302.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better

COSC 307.title: COSC 307
COSC 307.full_description: COSC 307 - Honors: Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Same as COSC 302 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 307.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better

COSC 111.title: COSC 111
COSC 111.full_description: COSC 111 - Computational Thinking+the Art of Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to the thought processes of computer science+the art of programming. Topics include learning to think algorithmically,+solve problems efficiently or using a high-level programming language+a variety of software tools+technologies. Skills learned include designing programs to solve problems or developing the algorithms needed or using abstractions or data structures+encapsulation or writing code to implement algorithms or testing the code for errors,+documenting the process+the outcome. This course welcomes students with limited or no programming experience.

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 351.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 357.title: ECE 357
ECE 357.full_description: ECE 357 - Honors: Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 351 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 357.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 335.title: ECE 335
ECE 335.full_description: ECE 335 - Electronic Devices 3 Credit Hours Semiconductor physics or theory of p-n junctions. Diodes or field-effect transistors,+bipolar transistors. Modeling of diode+transistor devices. Analysis+design of diode switching+rectifier circuits. Basic transistor switching circuits+single stage amplifiers. Electronic circuit simulation using SPICE. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 335.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better

ECE 395.title: ECE 395
ECE 395.full_description: ECE 395 - Junior Seminar 1 Credit Hours Presentations+discussions related to professional development or including registration or ethics,+current topics in electrical engineering. Grading Restriction: Satisfactory/No Credit grading only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 395.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better

ECE 313.title: ECE 313
ECE 313.full_description: ECE 313 - Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Probability axioms or Bayes’ theorem. Discrete+continuous random variables. Probability mass functions or density functions,+joint distributions. Central limit theorem. Expectation or variance or covariance,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 313.prereqs: MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

ECE 317.title: ECE 317
ECE 317.full_description: ECE 317 - Honors: Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 313 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 317.prereqs: MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

COSC 311.title: COSC 311
COSC 311.full_description: COSC 311 - Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Sets or functions or relations or equivalence relations or partial orderings+proof techniques or especially mathematical induction. Application of proof techniques to prove correctness of algorithms. Introduction to basic counting+combinatorics. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 311.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

COSC 317.title: COSC 317
COSC 317.full_description: COSC 317 - Honors: Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 311 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 317.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

COSC 360.title: COSC 360
COSC 360.full_description: COSC 360 - Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours In-depth introduction to C+its use in system programming. Introduction to memory+process layout or system calls or buffering or file I/O or file systems or directories or metadata or assembly code or stack frames or memory management or process management,+interprocess communication. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 360.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better

COSC 367.title: COSC 367
COSC 367.full_description: COSC 367 - Honors: Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours Same as COSC 360 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 367.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better

ECE 315.title: ECE 315
ECE 315.full_description: ECE 315 - Signals+Systems I 3 Credit Hours Continuous-+discrete-time functions or function transformations or signal energy+power or solution of linear differential equations or system properties or convolution or continuous+discrete-time Fourier series or continuous+discrete-time Fourier transforms or Bode diagrams,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 315.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better

ECE 356.title: ECE 356
ECE 356.full_description: ECE 356 - Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Architecture+design of microcomputer systems with microprocessors or microcontrollers. Instruction set architectures or software interfaces or processor structures or memory hierarchy,+interfacing. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or COSC 230 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 356.prereqs: ECE 256 or COSC 230 with a grade of C or better

ECE 358.title: ECE 358
ECE 358.full_description: ECE 358 - Honors: Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 356 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 358.prereqs: ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 401.title: ECE 401
ECE 401.full_description: ECE 401 - Senior Design Theory 2 Credit Hours A design course that focuses the student’s attention on professional practice or ethics or accumulated background of curricular components,+recent developments in the field. The focus is on teaching both the design process+design principles that allow students to utilize all of the above elements to effectively create designs for major design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 315 or ECE 351 or ECE 357 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 401.prereqs: ECE 315 or ECE 351 or ECE 357 with a grade of C or better

ECE 402.title: ECE 402
ECE 402.full_description: ECE 402 - Senior Design Practicum 3 Credit Hours A project-oriented course that requires teams of students to design a major project that incorporates the principles taught in ECE 401 . The design emphasis is directed to topics within the field of electrical+computer engineering. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (WC) (OC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 401 with a grade of C or better;+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 402.prereqs: ECE 401 with a grade of C or better;+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298 with a grade of C or better

COSC 340.title: COSC 340
COSC 340.full_description: COSC 340 - Software Engineering 3 Credit Hours Introduction to software processes that can be used on large projects to help design or manage or maintain,+test software. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 340.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better

COSC 361.title: COSC 361
COSC 361.full_description: COSC 361 - Operating Systems 3 Credit Hours Threads or operating system structure or process management or scheduling or synchronization or deadlock or memory management or virtual memory+demand paging or file system management+implementation or mass storage structure or protection or security,+distributed systems. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 361.prereqs: COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

COSC 366.title: COSC 366
COSC 366.full_description: COSC 366 - Introduction to Cybersecurity 3 Credit Hours A broad introduction to cybersecurity concepts. The class will introduce basic topics core to understanding computer security including security goals or threat modeling or software security or operating system security or cryptography or network security,+human factors. Coursework focuses on helping students adapt a security aware mindset when designing or developing,+testing systems. Credit Restriction: Cannot receive credit for both ECE 461+COSC 366.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 366.prereqs: COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 433.title: ECE 433
ECE 433.full_description: ECE 433 - Introduction to VLSI 3 Credit Hours Investigates the behavior of microelectronic devices in digital circuits+helps the students develop an understanding of the relationship between the device physics+the device static+dynamic characteristics. Includes laboratory assignments which are designed to give advanced undergraduate students a working knowledge of CMOS digital integrated circuit technology or circuit design methodologies or including simulation+physical layout of CMOS digital circuit structures. (DE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 335 .

ECE 453.title: ECE 453
ECE 453.full_description: ECE 453 - Introduction to Computer Networks 3 Credit Hours Introduction to the design+implementation of computer networks. Topics to be covered include layered network architecture or physical media or data link protocols or network routing or transport layer or network programming interfaces such as sockets,+applications. Examples will be primarily based on protocols in the Internet. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisites with consent of instructor.
ECE 453.prereqs: COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

ECE 455.title: ECE 455
ECE 455.full_description: ECE 455 - Embedded Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Design+development of embedded systems for data acquisition+special-purpose computing systems. Topics covered include direct memory access or real-time software development or use of real-time operating systems or embedded system analysis,+embedded system networking. Students will learn approaches for improving embedded system performance in terms of power or speed+resource utilization. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 455.prereqs: ECE 256 with a grade of C or better

COSC 422.title: COSC 422
COSC 422.full_description: COSC 422 - Applied Machine Learning 3 Credit Hours Machine learning (ML) concepts; ML techniques for practical applications. ML approaches+learning methods in modeling+prediction of complex systems. Data acquisition+preprocessing or training or classification+prediction or modeling tools,+postprocessing+evaluation. Credit Restriction: May not be applied toward the computer science or computer engineering majors.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 or COSC 111 ; MATH 251 or MATH 257 ; MATH 241 or MATH 247 ;+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 or STAT 251 .Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisites with consent of instructor.
COSC 422.prereqs: COSC 102 or COSC 111 ; MATH 251 or MATH 257 ; MATH 241 or MATH 247 ;+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 or STAT 251

COSC 377.title: COSC 377
COSC 377.full_description: COSC 377 - Honors: Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 370 with additional honors project. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both COSC 377+MATH 371 .(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 377.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 427.title: COSC 427
COSC 427.full_description: COSC 427 - Honors: Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 420 with additional honors project. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

ECE 347.title: ECE 347
ECE 347.full_description: ECE 347 - Honors: Fields 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 341 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better.(DE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 232.
ECE 347.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better

ECE 417.title: ECE 417
ECE 417.full_description: ECE 417 - Honors: Computer Control Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 416 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 316 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 417.prereqs: ECE 316 with a grade of C or better

ECE 427.title: ECE 427
ECE 427.full_description: ECE 427 - Honors: Electric Energy Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 421 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 316 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 325 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 427.prereqs: ECE 316 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 325 with a grade of C or better

ECE 477.title: ECE 477
ECE 477.full_description: ECE 477 - Honors: Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 471 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 477.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 478.title: ECE 478
ECE 478.full_description: ECE 478 - Honors: Introduction to Digital Image Processing 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 472 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 478.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 487.title: ECE 487

COSC 101.title: COSC 101
COSC 101.full_description: COSC 101 - Introduction to Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to computational thinking+structured programming. Topics include problem solving+algorithm development with emphasis on conditional if/else statements or loop based iteration,+function calls. Students will also be given an overview of commonly used data structures such as arrays. Skills learned include designing a program to solving a problem or developing the algorithms needed or writing code to implement them or testing the code+correcting errors or as well as documenting how the code works.

MATH 130.full_description: MATH 130 - Precalculus I 4 Credit Hours Review of algebraic or logarithmic or exponential,+trigonometric functions. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 151 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 130.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score.Comment(s): For students who satisfy the course prerequisites for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 151 or but whose placement test scores indicate additional preparation is necessary.

Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 152 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 131.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Appropriate placement exam score.

EF 142.full_description: EF 142 - Introduction to Physics+Modeling for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours An introduction to physics concepts for engineering or ways to model these concepts using numerical methods,+skills+practices necessary for a successful engineering career. Skills learned will include the ability to apply physics concepts to real-world problems or ability to use programming software to model physics concepts,+the ability to recognize+practice concepts related to successful engineering practice such as working in teams or project management,+effective communication. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI) (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.

ENGL 101.title: ENGL 101
ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or better will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

ENGL 198.title: ENGL 198

Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in ENGL 198 may not subsequently receive credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 118.Comment(s): Restricted to Chancellor’s Honors Program students.

Course topic includes exploration of debates concerning the pursuit of truth+knowledge within different disciplines. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in ENGL 298 may not subsequently receive credit for ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 198.Comment(s): Restricted to Chancellor’s Honors Program students.

MATH 142.full_description: MATH 142 - Calculus II 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. EF 141.full_description: EF 141 - Introduction to Physics+Modeling for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours An introduction to physics concepts for engineering or ways to model these concepts using numerical methods,+skills+practices necessary for a successful engineering career. Topics include vectors or kinematics or Newton’s Laws or forces or numerical methods applications for modeling highlighted physics concepts,+an introduction to the university or exploration of engineering disciplines,+personal or academic,+professional skills development. Skills learned will include the ability to apply physics concepts to real-world problems or ability to use programming software to model physics concepts,+the ability to recognize+practice concepts related to successful engineering practice such as time management+a working knowledge of tools+strategies valuable to engineering study. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI)Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 131 .Comment(s): Students who receive any grade in EF 151 or EF 157 may not register for EF 141 without instructor permission.Registration Restriction(s): Majors in the College of Engineering or Biosystems Engineering.

PHYS 135.full_description: PHYS 135 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of mechanics or sound or waves,+thermodynamics. PHYS 137.full_description: PHYS 137 - Honors: Fundamentals of Physics for Physics Majors I 5 Credit Hours Honors version of PHYS 135. ECE 201.title: ECE 201
ECE 201.full_description: ECE 201 - Circuits I 3 Credit Hours Fundamental laws of circuit analysis. Ohm’s Law. Kirchhoff’s current+voltage laws; the law of conservation of energy; circuits containing independent+dependent voltage,+current sources or resistance or conductance or capacitance,+inductance analyzed using mesh+nodal analysis or superposition,+source of transformations;+Norton’s+Thevenin’s Theorems. Steady state analysis of DC+AC circuits. Complete solution for transient analysis for circuits with one+two storage elements. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 231 .Comment(s): For electrical engineering+computer engineering students only.Registration Permission: Consent of associate department head.
ECE 201.prereqs: EF 152 or EF 158 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

ECE 255.full_description: ECE 255 - Introduction to Digital Logic Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to digital logic design techniques or including the implementation of combinational+sequential logic. Topics include number systems or base conversions or Boolean algebra or finite state machines,+techniques for minimizing Boolean functions+logic circuits. Laboratory exercises will provide hands-on experience implementing digital logic circuits using discrete components+programmable logic devices. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 255.prereqs: COSC 102 with a grade of C or better

PHYS 231.full_description: PHYS 231 - Fundamentals of Physics: Electricity+Magnetism 3 Credit Hours For engineers+majors in mathematics+the physical sciences. MATH 231.full_description: MATH 231 - Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours First course emphasizing solution techniques. MATH 237.full_description: MATH 237 - Honors: Differential Equations I 3 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 231 . (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

CHEM 122.title: CHEM 122
CHEM 122.full_description: CHEM 122 - General Chemistry I 3 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Modern atomic theory or chemical bonding or molecular structures+geometries or stoichiometry,+quantitative aspects of solution chemistry or gas laws,+chemical energy. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses – CHEM 100 or CHEM 102 or CHEM 120 or CHEM 122 or CHEM 128.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 or Math ACT score of 25 or higher or SAT Math score of 620 or higher.(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 123.

Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 122.

CHEM 128.full_description: CHEM 128 - Honors: General Chemistry I 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include atomic structure+bonding or molecular structure or spectroscopy or chemical reactions+stoichiometry or introduction to organic compounds+reactions or intermolecular forces+phase transitions or behavior of gases. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following courses or sequences – CHEM 112-CHEM 113 or CHEM 122-CHEM 123 or CHEM 128.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ACT Composite score of 30 or higher or permission of instructor.

PHYS 136.full_description: PHYS 136 - Introduction to Physics for Physical Science+Mathematics Majors II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based physics of electricity or magnetism,+optics. May be taught as lecture with lab or integrated lecture+lab or online with on-campus lab. Check with instructor. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+2 hours lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 135 or PHYS 137.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Comment(s): Alternative to PHYS 138 for physics majors.

PHYS 138.title: PHYS 138
PHYS 138.full_description: PHYS 138 - Honors: Fundamentals of Physics for Physics Majors II 5 Credit Hours Honors version of PHYS 136. ECE 202.title: ECE 202
ECE 202.full_description: ECE 202 - Circuits II 3 Credit Hours Operational amplifiers or average or complex or imaginary+real power; effective values of voltage+currents or three phase circuits or delta+wye connections. Complex frequency; sinusoidal forcing functions+natural response. Resonance: general case or special cases in series+parallel circuits. Scaling: magnitude+frequency. Mutual inductance or transformers as circuit elements; linear+ideal transformers. Admittance or impedance,+hybrid parameters. Trigonometric+complex Fourier series. Includes laboratory exercises. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 201 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 202.prereqs: ECE 201 with a grade of C or better

MATH 241.title: MATH 241
MATH 241.full_description: MATH 241 - Calculus III 4 Credit Hours Calculus of functions in two or more dimensions. Includes solid analytic geometry or partial differentiation or multiple integration,+selected topics in vector calculus. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 247.title: MATH 247
MATH 247.full_description: MATH 247 - Honors: Calculus III 4 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score+credit for MATH 142 or permission from the instructor to enroll.

MATH 251.title: MATH 251
MATH 251.full_description: MATH 251 - Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours First course in the algebra of simultaneous linear equations+matrices. Includes Gaussian elimination or determinants or vector spaces or linear transformations or eigenvalues,+eigenvectors. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 257.title: MATH 257
MATH 257.full_description: MATH 257 - Honors: Matrix Algebra I 3 Credit Hours (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 148.

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 256.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

COSC 302.title: COSC 302
COSC 302.full_description: COSC 302 - Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Design or analysis,+implementation of fundamental data structures+algorithms including list+tree-based sorting or graph algorithms+dynamic programming. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 302.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better

COSC 307.title: COSC 307
COSC 307.full_description: COSC 307 - Honors: Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Same as COSC 302 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better.
