COSC 111.title: COSC 111
COSC 111.full_description: COSC 111 - Computational Thinking+the Art of Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to the thought processes of computer science+the art of programming. Topics include learning to think algorithmically,+solve problems efficiently or using a high-level programming language+a variety of software tools+technologies. Skills learned include designing programs to solve problems or developing the algorithms needed or using abstractions or data structures+encapsulation or writing code to implement algorithms or testing the code for errors,+documenting the process+the outcome. This course welcomes students with limited or no programming experience. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (QR)

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 351.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 357.title: ECE 357
ECE 357.full_description: ECE 357 - Honors: Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 351 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 357.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 335.title: ECE 335
ECE 335.full_description: ECE 335 - Electronic Devices 3 Credit Hours Semiconductor physics or theory of p-n junctions. Diodes or field-effect transistors,+bipolar transistors. Modeling of diode+transistor devices. Analysis+design of diode switching+rectifier circuits. Basic transistor switching circuits+single stage amplifiers. Electronic circuit simulation using SPICE. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 335.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better

ECE 395.title: ECE 395
ECE 395.full_description: ECE 395 - Junior Seminar 1 Credit Hours Presentations+discussions related to professional development or including registration or ethics,+current topics in electrical+computer engineering. Students will analyze aspects of scientific+technical writing+write a series of articles suitable for the general public. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298.
ECE 395.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298

ECE 313.title: ECE 313
ECE 313.full_description: ECE 313 - Probability+Random Variables 3 Credit Hours Probability axioms or Bayes’ theorem. Discrete+continuous random variables. Probability mass functions or density functions,+joint distributions. Central limit theorem. Expectation or variance or covariance,+correlation. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.

ECE 201.title: ECE 201

Kirchhoff’s current+voltage laws; the law of conservation of energy; circuits containing independent+dependent voltage,+current sources or resistance or conductance or capacitance,+inductance analyzed using mesh+nodal analysis or superposition,+source of transformations;+Norton’s+Thevenin’s Theorems. EF 203.title: EF 203
EF 203.full_description: EF 203 - Engineering Based Problem Solving 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop engineering focused critical problem solving skills for undergraduate engineering+business majors. Students are introduced to engineering problems from a systems perspective or allowing students to analyze a range of systems from simple entities to larger more complex systems such as organizations. There are three phases of the critical problem solving skills as exemplified by the DRIVES model. The first phase focuses on defining the right problem. The second phase details a solution based on the concepts of flow or variation,+disruption. The third phase introduces the sustainability of the solution based on the concepts of reliability+the role of culture in design. Alternative solutions will be reviewed from a business perspective. Registration Restriction(s): Sophomore standing.

EF 303.title: EF 303
EF 303.full_description: EF 303 - Creating Synergies in Business+Engineering Collaborations 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop the skills+understanding to create effective cross disciplinary engineering+business teams. Students will work to understand the key requirements of projects from both the business+engineering perspective. Additionally or students will be able to apply basic engineering principles in a business context. Scenarios in new product development+operations will be considered. Topics may include identifying needs/key requirements or project management,+sensitivity analysis of solutions from the profit+loss perspective. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 203 or consent of instructor.

COSC 111.title: COSC 111
COSC 111.full_description: COSC 111 - Computational Thinking+the Art of Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to the thought processes of computer science+the art of programming. Topics include learning to think algorithmically,+solve problems efficiently or using a high-level programming language+a variety of software tools+technologies. Skills learned include designing programs to solve problems or developing the algorithms needed or using abstractions or data structures+encapsulation or writing code to implement algorithms or testing the code for errors,+documenting the process+the outcome. This course welcomes students with limited or no programming experience.

ECE 341.title: ECE 341
ECE 341.full_description: ECE 341 - Fields 3 Credit Hours Coulomb’s law or Gauss’ law or Ampere’s law or Maxwell’s equations for electrostatic+magnetostatic cases. Maxwell’s equations for dynamic case or dynamic potentials,+uniform plane wave propagation. Transmission lines. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better.(DE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 232.
ECE 341.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better

ECE 347.title: ECE 347
ECE 347.full_description: ECE 347 - Honors: Fields 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 341 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better.(DE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 232.
ECE 347.prereqs: ECE 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 241 or MATH 247 with a grade of C or better

ECE 316.title: ECE 316
ECE 316.full_description: ECE 316 - Signals+Systems II 3 Credit Hours Sampling theory or theory+application of Laplace transforms or feedback or root locus or gain+phase margin or theory+application of z Transforms or digital filters,+discrete-time state variables. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 315 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 316.prereqs: ECE 315 with a grade of C or better

ECE 336.title: ECE 336
ECE 336.full_description: ECE 336 - Electronic Circuits 3 Credit Hours Multistage transistor amplifier biasing. Gain stages+output stages. Frequency+transient response of open loop linear amplifiers. Fundamentals of integrated circuits+operational amplifier applications in basic feedback configurations. Basic transistor switching circuits. Includes laboratory experiments+design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 335 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): ECE 315 .
ECE 336.prereqs: ECE 335 with a grade of C or better

ECE 342.title: ECE 342
ECE 342.full_description: ECE 342 - Fundamentals of Communications 3 Credit Hours Probability+random processes or communication channels or analog modulations or digital modulations or diversity or MIMO or channel coding or information theory or laboratory sessions. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 315 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 342.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 315 with a grade of C or better

ECE 401.title: ECE 401
ECE 401.full_description: ECE 401 - Senior Design Theory 2 Credit Hours A design course that focuses the student’s attention on professional practice or ethics or accumulated background of curricular components,+recent developments in the field. The focus is on teaching both the design process+design principles that allow students to utilize all of the above elements to effectively create designs for major design projects. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 315 or ECE 351 or ECE 357 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 401.prereqs: ECE 315 or ECE 351 or ECE 357 with a grade of C or better

CHEM 132.title: CHEM 132
CHEM 132.full_description: CHEM 132 - General Chemistry II 3 Credit Hours A general course in theoretical+descriptive chemistry. Intermolecular forces or kinetics or chemical equilibria or acid+base chemistry or thermodynamics or electrochemistry,+introduction to coordination chemistry. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Credit Restriction: Credit may be received for only one of the following - CHEM 100 or CHEM 102 or CHEM 130 or CHEM 132 or CHEM 138.(RE) Prerequisite(s): CHEM 122 or CHEM 128 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 133
CHEM 132.prereqs: CHEM 122 or CHEM 128 with a grade of C or better

CHEM 133.title: CHEM 133
CHEM 133.full_description: CHEM 133 - General Chemistry II Laboratory 1 Credit Hours Experiments focusing on the topics discussed in CHEM 132+covering intermolecular forces or properties of solutions or kinetics or equilibrium or acid-base reactions or thermodynamics,+other topics covered in general chemistry II. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): CHEM 123 or CHEM 128 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): CHEM 132.
CHEM 133.prereqs: CHEM 123 or CHEM 128 with a grade of C or better

CHEM 138.title: CHEM 138
CHEM 138.full_description: CHEM 138 - Honors: General Chemistry II 4 Credit Hours A sophisticated treatment of the principles of chemistry designed for students who are well prepared for a thorough+systematic study of chemistry. Topics include chemical equilibrium or thermodynamics or kinetics or transition metal complexes,+nuclear chemistry. Satisfies General Education Requirement: (NS)Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): CHEM 128.

COSC 311.title: COSC 311
COSC 311.full_description: COSC 311 - Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Sets or functions or relations or equivalence relations or partial orderings+proof techniques or especially mathematical induction. Application of proof techniques to prove correctness of algorithms. Introduction to basic counting+combinatorics. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 311.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

MATH 300.title: MATH 300
MATH 300.full_description: MATH 300 - Introduction to Abstract Mathematics 3 Credit Hours Algebra of sets or functions or relations,+mathematical induction. Algebraic structure of the real number system order properties,+completeness. (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.

MATH 307.title: MATH 307
MATH 307.full_description: MATH 307 - Honors: Introduction to Abstract Mathematics 3 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 300 . (RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 142 or MATH 148.Comment(s): For current+prospective math majors or honors students,+well-prepared students.

COSC 370.title: COSC 370
COSC 370.full_description: COSC 370 - Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours The design or analysis,+implementation of numerical algorithms for solving problems in science+engineering. Emphasis on program design or including data structures or computational complexity or scientific computing environments,+high-performance software packages. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both COSC 370+MATH 371 .(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 370.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 422.title: COSC 422
COSC 422.full_description: COSC 422 - Applied Machine Learning 3 Credit Hours Machine learning (ML) concepts; ML techniques for practical applications. ML approaches+learning methods in modeling+prediction of complex systems. Data acquisition+preprocessing or training or classification+prediction or modeling tools,+postprocessing+evaluation. Credit Restriction: May not be applied toward the computer science or computer engineering majors.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 or COSC 111 ; MATH 251 or MATH 257 ; MATH 241 or MATH 247 ;+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 or STAT 251 .Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisites with consent of instructor.
COSC 422.prereqs: COSC 102 or COSC 111 ; MATH 251 or MATH 257 ; MATH 241 or MATH 247 ;+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 or STAT 251

COSC 425.title: COSC 425
COSC 425.full_description: COSC 425 - Introduction to Machine Learning 3 Credit Hours Machine learning is concerned with computer programs that automatically improve their performance through experience. This course covers the theory+practice of machine learning from a variety of perspectives. We cover topics such as clustering or decision trees or neural network learning or statistical learning methods or Bayesian learning methods or dimension reduction or kernel methods,+reinforcement learning. Programming assignments include implementation+hands-on experiments with various learning algorithms. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.
COSC 425.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 256.title: ECE 256
ECE 256.full_description: ECE 256 - Computer System Interfaces 3 Credit Hours Introduction to design or implementation,+test of interfaces used in the construction of modern computing systems. Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 256.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 351.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 356.title: ECE 356
ECE 356.full_description: ECE 356 - Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Architecture+design of microcomputer systems with microprocessors or microcontrollers. Instruction set architectures or software interfaces or processor structures or memory hierarchy,+interfacing. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or COSC 230 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 356.prereqs: ECE 256 or COSC 230 with a grade of C or better

ECE 358.title: ECE 358
ECE 358.full_description: ECE 358 - Honors: Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 356 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 358.prereqs: ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

EF 203.title: EF 203
EF 203.full_description: EF 203 - Engineering Based Problem Solving 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop engineering focused critical problem solving skills for undergraduate engineering+business majors. Students are introduced to engineering problems from a systems perspective or allowing students to analyze a range of systems from simple entities to larger more complex systems such as organizations. There are three phases of the critical problem solving skills as exemplified by the DRIVES model. The first phase focuses on defining the right problem. The second phase details a solution based on the concepts of flow or variation,+disruption. The third phase introduces the sustainability of the solution based on the concepts of reliability+the role of culture in design. Alternative solutions will be reviewed from a business perspective. Registration Restriction(s): Sophomore standing.

EF 303.title: EF 303
EF 303.full_description: EF 303 - Creating Synergies in Business+Engineering Collaborations 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop the skills+understanding to create effective cross disciplinary engineering+business teams. Students will work to understand the key requirements of projects from both the business+engineering perspective. Additionally or students will be able to apply basic engineering principles in a business context. Scenarios in new product development+operations will be considered. Topics may include identifying needs/key requirements or project management,+sensitivity analysis of solutions from the profit+loss perspective. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 203 or consent of instructor.

PHYS 250.title: PHYS 250
PHYS 250.full_description: PHYS 250 - Fundamentals of Physics: Modern Physics 4 Credit Hours Fundamental concepts of modern physics+their applications to atomic or nuclear or particle,+condensed matter physics or with lab. (RE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 136 or PHYS 138 or PHYS 231.

COSC 307.title: COSC 307
COSC 307.full_description: COSC 307 - Honors: Data Structures+Algorithms II 4 Credit Hours Same as COSC 302 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 307.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better

COSC 317.title: COSC 317
COSC 317.full_description: COSC 317 - Honors: Discrete Structures 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 311 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 317.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+either MATH 142 or MATH 148 with a grade of C or better

COSC 367.title: COSC 367
COSC 367.full_description: COSC 367 - Honors: Systems Programming 4 Credit Hours Same as COSC 360 with additional honors project. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 367.prereqs: COSC 302 or COSC 307 with a grade of C or better,+either COSC 230 or ECE 256 with a grade of C or better

COSC 377.title: COSC 377
COSC 377.full_description: COSC 377 - Honors: Introduction to Scientific Computing 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 370 with additional honors project. Credit Restriction: Students may not receive credit for both COSC 377+MATH 371 .(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
COSC 377.prereqs: COSC 202 with a grade of C or better,+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

COSC 427.title: COSC 427
COSC 427.full_description: COSC 427 - Honors: Biologically-Inspired Computation 3 Credit Hours Same as COSC 420 with additional honors project. Recommended Background: Completion of core courses.

ECE 357.title: ECE 357
ECE 357.full_description: ECE 357 - Honors: Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 351 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 357.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 417.title: ECE 417
ECE 417.full_description: ECE 417 - Honors: Computer Control Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 416 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 316 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 417.prereqs: ECE 316 with a grade of C or better

ECE 427.title: ECE 427
ECE 427.full_description: ECE 427 - Honors: Electric Energy Systems 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 421 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 316 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 325 with a grade of C or better.

ECE 477.title: ECE 477
ECE 477.full_description: ECE 477 - Honors: Introduction to Pattern Recognition 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 471 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 477.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 478.full_description: ECE 478 - Honors: Introduction to Digital Image Processing 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 472 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 478.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 200 or MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

ECE 487.title: ECE 487
ECE 487.full_description: ECE 487 - Honors: Power Electronics 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 481 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 316 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 325 with a grade of C or better.(DE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 336 .
ECE 487.prereqs: ECE 316 with a grade of C or better,+ECE 325 with a grade of C or better

ECE 402.title: ECE 402
ECE 402.full_description: ECE 402 - Senior Design Practicum 3 Credit Hours A project-oriented course that requires teams of students to design a major project that incorporates the principles taught in ECE 401. The design emphasis is directed to topics within the field of electrical+computer engineering. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (AOC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC) (OC)(RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 401 with a grade of C or better;+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 402.prereqs: ECE 401 with a grade of C or better;+ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 290 or ENGL 298 with a grade of C or better

ECE 202.title: ECE 202
ECE 202.full_description: ECE 202 - Circuits II 3 Credit Hours Operational amplifiers or average or complex or imaginary+real power; effective values of voltage+currents or three phase circuits or delta+wye connections. Complex frequency; sinusoidal forcing functions+natural response. Resonance: general case or special cases in series+parallel circuits. Scaling: magnitude+frequency. Mutual inductance or transformers as circuit elements; linear+ideal transformers. Admittance or impedance,+hybrid parameters. Trigonometric+complex Fourier series. Includes laboratory exercises. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 201 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 202.prereqs: ECE 201 with a grade of C or better

COSC 101.title: COSC 101
COSC 101.full_description: COSC 101 - Introduction to Programming 3 Credit Hours An introduction to computational thinking+structured programming. Topics include problem solving+algorithm development with emphasis on conditional if/else statements or loop based iteration,+function calls. Students will also be given an overview of commonly used data structures such as arrays. Skills learned include designing a program to solving a problem or developing the algorithms needed or writing code to implement them or testing the code+correcting errors or as well as documenting how the code works.

MATH 130.title: MATH 130
MATH 130.full_description: MATH 130 - Precalculus I 4 Credit Hours Review of algebraic or logarithmic or exponential,+trigonometric functions. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 151 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 130.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score.Comment(s): For students who satisfy the course prerequisites for MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 151 or but whose placement test scores indicate additional preparation is necessary.
MATH 130.prereqs: MATH 119 with a grade of C or better or appropriate placement exam score

MATH 131.title: MATH 131
MATH 131.full_description: MATH 131 - Calculus 1A Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Single variable calculus or infused with precalculus or especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications+relevant precalculus. Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 141 or MATH 147 or MATH 152 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 131.(RE) Prerequisite(s): Appropriate placement exam score.

EF 142.title: EF 142
EF 142.full_description: EF 142 - Introduction to Physics+Modeling for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours An introduction to physics concepts for engineering or ways to model these concepts using numerical methods,+skills+practices necessary for a successful engineering career. Topics include work-energy principle or conservation of energy+momentum or application of physics in circular motion or numerical methods applications for modeling highlighted physics concepts or exploration of engineering disciplines or teamwork or project management,+communication skills. Skills learned will include the ability to apply physics concepts to real-world problems or ability to use programming software to model physics concepts,+the ability to recognize+practice concepts related to successful engineering practice such as working in teams or project management,+effective communication. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI)Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 141+MATH 131 .(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132.Registration Restriction(s): Majors in the College of Engineering or Biosystems Engineering.

EF 151.title: EF 151
EF 151.full_description: EF 151 - Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including vectors or kinematics or Newton’s laws or forces or work-energy,+impulse-momentum. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines. Examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI) (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.
EF 151.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

EF 157.title: EF 157
EF 157.full_description: EF 157 - Honors: Physics for Engineers I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 151 for well-prepared students. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI) (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Corequisite(s): EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher.Recommended Background: At least one year of high school physics.Registration Restriction(s): Major in the Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering; enrolled in Engineering Honors Program.
EF 157.coreqs: EF 105 or COSC 101 or COSC 102 ;+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or higher

ENGL 101.title: ENGL 101
ENGL 101.full_description: ENGL 101 - English Composition I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for reading critically or analyzing texts from diverse perspectives or developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 118 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 103 .

ENGL 118.title: ENGL 118
ENGL 118.full_description: ENGL 118 - Honors: English Composition 3 Credit Hours Grading scale+workload are same as in regular sequence though course proceeds at an accelerated pace. Emphasis on argumentation or critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis,+research methods. May include the study of a long work of literature or nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 118.Comment(s): ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280 required. Students receiving a passing grade below B in ENGL 118 will complete the English Composition requirement by taking ENGL 102. Students receiving a grade of B or better will complete their freshman English requirements by choosing ENGL 102 or a sophomore-level course in the English Department or ENGL 355.

ENGL 131.title: ENGL 131
ENGL 131.full_description: ENGL 131 - Composition for Non-Native Speakers of English I 3 Credit Hours Intensive instruction in writing or focusing on analysis+argument. Strategies for developing substantive arguments through systematic revision or addressing specific audiences or integrating sources,+expressing ideas with clarity+correctness. Individual conferences. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 118 or ENGL 198 may not receive credit for ENGL 131.Comment(s): Admission based on TOEFL or IELTS or ACT or SAT score or by English Placement Exam.

ENGL 198.title: ENGL 198
ENGL 198.full_description: ENGL 198 - Chancellor’s Honors Writing I 3 Credit Hours Intensive writing+research instruction or with emphasis on critical inquiry or rhetorical analysis or persuasion/argumentation,+primary+secondary source research. Course topic includes exploration of debates concerning “human nature.” Includes the study of longer works of nonfiction in addition to a selection of interdisciplinary readings. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in ENGL 198 may not subsequently receive credit for ENGL 101 or ENGL 131 or ENGL 118.Comment(s): Restricted to Chancellor’s Honors Program students.

MATH 132.title: MATH 132
MATH 132.full_description: MATH 132 - Calculus 1B Infused with Precalculus 3 Credit Hours Continuation of MATH 131 . Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (QR)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (QR)(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 131 .

MATH 141.title: MATH 141
MATH 141.full_description: MATH 141 - Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Single variable calculus especially for students of science or engineering or mathematics,+computer science. Differential calculus with applications. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (QR)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (QR)Credit Restriction: Students who receive a grade of C or better in MATH 132 may not subsequently receive credit for MATH 141.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.
MATH 141.prereqs: MATH 130 with a grade of C or better

MATH 147.title: MATH 147
MATH 147.full_description: MATH 147 - Honors: Calculus I 4 Credit Hours Honors version of MATH 141 for well-prepared students. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (QR)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (QR)Credit Restriction: Credit will not be given for both MATH 147+MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 152.(RE) Prerequisite(s): MATH 130 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Students should have a 32 mathematics ACT score or a 700 quantitative SAT score or permission from the instructor to enroll.
MATH 147.prereqs: MATH 130 with a grade of C or better

COSC 102.title: COSC 102
COSC 102.full_description: COSC 102 - Introduction to Computer Science 4 Credit Hours Modular programming in an object-oriented programming language or including string+vector manipulation or file I/O or bit operators or Boolean algebra or pointers or simple sorting+binary search or plus introductions to recursion+templates. Contact Hour Distribution: 3 hours lecture+1 lab.Grading Restriction: Letter grade only.Credit Restriction: Students who have received credit for COSC 202 or COSC 230 may not receive subsequent credit for COSC 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 101 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 132 or MATH 141 or MATH 147.
COSC 102.prereqs: COSC 101 with a grade of C or better

EF 152.full_description: EF 152 - Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Calculus-based study of basic physics concepts or including rotational dynamics or statics or oscillations or waves or fluids or heat+temperature,+first+second law of thermodynamics. Introduction to team work. Introduction to the engineering disciplines or examination of engineering principles+design issues. Oral+written presentation skills. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI) (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 151 with a grade of C or better or EF 142 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142.Registration Restriction(s): Tickle College of Engineering or biosystems engineering majors.
EF 152.prereqs: EF 151 with a grade of C or better or EF 142 with a grade of C or better

EF 158.title: EF 158
EF 158.full_description: EF 158 - Honors: Physics for Engineers II 4 Credit Hours Honors version of EF 152. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (EI) (NS)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 157 with a grade of C or better.(RE) Corequisite(s): MATH 142 or higher.
EF 158.prereqs: EF 157 with a grade of C or better

ENGL 102.title: ENGL 102
ENGL 102.full_description: ENGL 102 - English Composition II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in ENGL 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 132 or ENGL 298 or ENGL 290 may not receive credit for ENGL 102.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 101.Comment(s): Students wishing additional help with writing should also register for ENGL 104 .

ENGL 132.title: ENGL 132
ENGL 132.full_description: ENGL 132 - Composition for Non-Native Speakers of English II 3 Credit Hours Advancing concepts introduced in ENGL 131 or ENGL 101. Intensive writing instruction focused on inquiry+research. Strategies for formulating+investigating questions or locating+evaluating information or using varied sources+research methods or developing positions on intercultural+interdisciplinary issues from diverse texts (print or digital,+multimedia),+presenting research using appropriate rhetorical conventions. Individual conferences. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (WC)Satisfies General Education Requirement through the 2021-2022 academic catalog: (WC)Grading Restriction: ABC/N grading only.Credit Restriction: Students with credit for ENGL 102 or ENGL 132 or ENGL 298 may not receive credit for ENGL 290.(RE) Prerequisite(s): ENGL 101 through AP Credit.Comment(s): Students are required to have ACT English+composite scores at or above 29 or SAT critical reading+composite scores of 680+1280. ENGL 298.title: ENGL 298

Course topic includes exploration of debates concerning the pursuit of truth+knowledge within different disciplines. Credit Restriction: May not be applied toward the computer science or computer engineering majors.(RE) Prerequisite(s): COSC 102 or COSC 111; MATH 251 or MATH 257 ; MATH 241 or MATH 247 ;+ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 or STAT 251 .Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisites with consent of instructor.

This course covers the theory+practice of machine learning from a variety of perspectives. We cover topics such as clustering or decision trees or neural network learning or statistical learning methods or Bayesian learning methods or dimension reduction or kernel methods,+reinforcement learning. Programming assignments include implementation+hands-on experiments with various learning algorithms. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better.Comment(s): Prior knowledge may satisfy prerequisite with consent of instructor.
COSC 425.prereqs: ECE 313 or ECE 317 or MATH 323 with a grade of C or better;+MATH 251 or MATH 257 with a grade of C or better

Topics covered include memory+I/O devices or component interfaces or real-time operating system concepts or performance analysis,+optimizations. The lectures+lab assignments will cover both hardware+software elements needed to support target applications+interfaces. This includes physical layer+low-level protocol/information-format design+analysis. Other key elements covered in the class include direct memory access or timers or input/output synchronization,+interrupts. Emphasis is placed on hands-on+lab based exercises using an appropriate development system. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 256.prereqs: ECE 255 with a grade of C or better

ECE 351.title: ECE 351
ECE 351.full_description: ECE 351 - Digital Systems Design 3 Credit Hours Introduction to techniques+strategies for designing digital systems using hardware description languages+industry-standard design tools. Topics include simulation+synthesis of high-level designs or finite state-machine design or digital memory systems or arithmetic circuit design or circuit delay estimation or timing,+power analysis. Laboratory+project activities include the implementation of digital systems using field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 255 with a grade of C or better.

ECE 358.full_description: ECE 358 - Honors: Computer Systems Architecture 3 Credit Hours Same as ECE 356 with additional honors project. (RE) Prerequisite(s): ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better.
ECE 358.prereqs: ECE 256 or ECE 336 or COSC 360 or COSC 367 with a grade of C or better

EF 203.title: EF 203
EF 203.full_description: EF 203 - Engineering Based Problem Solving 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop engineering focused critical problem solving skills for undergraduate engineering+business majors. Students are introduced to engineering problems from a systems perspective or allowing students to analyze a range of systems from simple entities to larger more complex systems such as organizations. There are three phases of the critical problem solving skills as exemplified by the DRIVES model. The first phase focuses on defining the right problem. The second phase details a solution based on the concepts of flow or variation,+disruption. The third phase introduces the sustainability of the solution based on the concepts of reliability+the role of culture in design. Alternative solutions will be reviewed from a business perspective. Registration Restriction(s): Sophomore standing.

EF 303.title: EF 303
EF 303.full_description: EF 303 - Creating Synergies in Business+Engineering Collaborations 3 Credit Hours The objective is to develop the skills+understanding to create effective cross disciplinary engineering+business teams. Students will work to understand the key requirements of projects from both the business+engineering perspective. Additionally or students will be able to apply basic engineering principles in a business context. Scenarios in new product development+operations will be considered. Topics may include identifying needs/key requirements or project management,+sensitivity analysis of solutions from the profit+loss perspective. (RE) Prerequisite(s): EF 203 or consent of instructor.

PHYS 250.title: PHYS 250
PHYS 250.full_description: PHYS 250 - Fundamentals of Physics: Modern Physics 4 Credit Hours Fundamental concepts of modern physics+their applications to atomic or nuclear or particle,+condensed matter physics or with lab. Satisfies Volunteer Core Requirement: (NS)(RE) Prerequisite(s): PHYS 136 or PHYS 138 or PHYS 231.
